loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús, de 34 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y amable. Convive con james quien es empleado y padre de sus 4 hijos, Billy, James, Johnny y Patrick de 12, 10, 7 y 2 años de edad respectivamente. Juntos habitan la casa de su hermana, cuentan con terreno propio pero no lo habitan por lo lejos que se encuentra. 
La actividad que realiza Jesús es la venta de comida como tallarines, estofados, juanes  y refrescos por las mañanas en un puesto en el mercado de la ciudad, donde atiende cordialmente a sus clientes quienes la visitan a diario por la buena sazón en sus preparaciones.
Se inició hace más de 1 año, con un pequeño capital propio y gracias al apoyo de su hermano a logrado establecerse. Considera su negocio rentable por las ganancias que le deja y le ha servido para salir de muchos apuros, además de lo que prepara siempre queda algo para su familia, asi evita gastos de aliemnto en su hogar. 
Se decidió a empezar con su negocio por el deseo de contar con sus propios ingreso y no depender únicamente de su pareja, más bien apoyarlo con los gastos y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Ahora está ahorrando,  pues desea en un futuro abrir una bodega de abarrotes en su casa, para así estar más cerca de sus hijos durante el día. Éste será el préstamo número 04 con la institución MFP. Está agradecida y contenta de saber que contará con un apoyo financiero para realizar sus planes. Por eso se compromete a  cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Además está a gusto con su banco comunal por el apoyo que se brindan mutuamente.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus alimentos como arroz, azúcar, aceites y otros. Buscará precios bajos, así tendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jesús, 34 years old, is a friendly working woman. She lives with James who is an employee and father of her four children, Billy, James, Johnny and Patrick who are 12, 10, 7 and 2 years of age respectively. They live in her sister’s house. They have their own property but they don’t live there as it is so far away.

Jesús sells food such as noodles, stews, juanes (a Peruvian dish with chicken, rice, spices, beaten eggs and hard boiled eggs, bundled tightly in banana leaves and then placed in a pot to cook) and beverages in the morning at a stand in the city marketplace, where she cordially attends to her customers who visit her daily because of her tasty preparations.

She began this a little more than a year ago, with a little bit of her own capital and thanks to the support of her brother she successfully established herself. She considers her business profitable because the earnings have helped her through many predicaments, and besides that she is always preparing something for her family, and so avoids food household expenses. 

She started her business with the desire of having her own earnings and not to depend only on her partner, but to support him with the expenses and to bring a better quality of life to her family. Now she is saving because in the future she wants to open a grocery store at home, in order to be closer to her children during the day. This will be her fourth loan through MFP. She is grateful and happy knowing she has financial support to reach her plans, and she agrees to comply with the payment plan as she did with her previous loans. She also likes the communal bank because of the support they give each other.

With the amount requested of 1000 soles, she will buy the necessary ingredients in order to make her dishes such as rice, sugar, oil, and more. She will search for low prices in order to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil and more

loans.name: Maranatha 2 Group

texts.en:
Bienvenue, age 50, is married and has two children, 17 and 25 years old. The 17-year-old is still in school, and the older child is working. Bienvenue is representing the Maranatha 2 Group. She sells children and baby's clothes in a local market. She has had this business for 20 years. She has gained a good reputation in the community, and many people know about her business. She will use the loan proceeds to buy more clothing to sell. Her business strategy is to offer friendly customer service to all her clients.
Bienvenue has received three previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. She wants to grow her business and become a great businesswoman. She hopes her children work in commerce, as she does.

loans.use: to pay for baby and children's clothes to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Redempteur 2 (1) Group

texts.en:
David, age 52, is married and has three children, ages 13 to 33. Two of his children currently attend school. David is representing the Redempteur 2 (1) group. He owns and operates a restaurant. He has had this business for nine years. He will use the loan proceeds to buy drinks and a freezer for his restaurant. His business strategy is to keep his restaurant clean, up-to-date, and organized. He wants to give his customers a good dining experience. 
David has received three previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. Currently, he is renting the restaurant space, but in the future he hopes to own his own place. He wants his children to succeed in life. He is thrilled that his second child is attending college.

loans.use: to pay for drinks and a freezer for his restaurant.

loans.name: Karrar

texts.en:
Karrar is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 21 years old, single, and lives with five family members, of whom three are employed.
Karrar is a carpenter and specializes in making all types of furniture. He established his business in 2003. He has built up good experience in this field, and he is being well known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation.
He is requesting a youth loan of $3,000 to buy a specialized machine for his work. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a specialized machine for his work, making furniture.

loans.name: La Bienfaisance 2 Group

texts.en:
Berthe, age 48, is a member of La Bienfaisance 2 group. She sells wood, charcoal, salted fish, and other products at her local market. She has been a vendor in the market for 15 years. She has gained a good reputation over the years. 

Berthe and her husband have raised three children, now between the ages of 27 and 32. She also cares and provides for two nephews.

She will use the loan funds to buy oil, flour, salted fish, rice, and charcoal. She also plans to travel to Pointe Noire, a city on the coast, to buy merchandise because fish and other products are cheaper there. Her business strategy is to sell popular items that her customers want.

Berthe has received three previous loans from Kiva partner HOPE Congo. She has a good repayment record. She hopes to buy a piece of land for her family and eventually a car.

loans.use: to buy wood, charcoal, salted fish, oil, rice, and flour

loans.name: Le Tresor 1 Group

texts.en:
Blaise is 45 years old and divorced. He has two children, ages 7 and 28, and his youngest child is currently attending school. For the past seven years, Blaise has operated a small chicken farm, raising chickens and selling eggs to vendors around Brazzaville. His business strategy is to deliver the eggs to his vendors, instead of having them come to him. Blaise also delivers eggs directly to the houses of certain clients. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from the Kiva partner HOPE Congo. 

Blaise is requesting a loan as a representative of the Le Tresor 1 group. He will use his portion of the loan to buy chicken feed. Currently, he keeps his chickens near his house on a piece of land in the city. In the future, Blaise wants to move his farm to a new location a little outside of Brazzaville and be able to buy the land, build a house for his family, and have a larger chicken farm.

loans.use: to pay for chicken feed

loans.name: Dieu Merci 2 Group

texts.en:
Elisabeth, age 51, is single with three children, ages 17 to 31 years old. The youngest is currently attending school. Elizabeth is representing the Dieu Merci 2 group. 

Elisabeth has a small restaurant and has been operating it for 27 years! She has gained many loyal customers in the community over the years because of her great food. She will use the loan to buy a freezer to keep her food in. Her business strategy is friendly customer service and to have everything clean and presentable in her restaurant. 

Elisabeth has received five previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. She hopes to buy a parcel of land and build a house for her family one day.

loans.use: to pay for a freezer.

loans.name: Yetana Group

texts.en:
Yetana is a group of 13 farmers in Bungoma District represented by Pamela. The group has 9 women and 4 men. Pamela is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize, millet and sorghum. Pamela is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and use increased profits to send her children to school.

Pamela described her harvest last year as poor. She hopes as a One Acre Fund farmer she will be able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and perhaps invest in another business. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Pamela's group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 6.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: La Bienfaisance 1 Group

texts.en:
Xavier, age 40, is single and has three children, 9 to 16 years old. All three of his children are attending school. He is representing the La Bienfaisance 1 group. Xavier has a small grocery boutique where he sells a variety of food products. He will use the loan proceeds to buy sugar, oil, rice, salt and tomatoes. His business strategy is to be very nice to the customers and to offer friendly and helpful service. 
Xavier has received three previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. Xavier wants to continue to grow his business and build a large space for his store. He wants all of his children to go to school and be well educated.

loans.use: to pay for sugar, oil, rice, salt and tomatoes for his grocery boutique.

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Hussain is from Iraq. He is 47 years old, married and has three children. Hussain is the only provider of the family.

Hussain is a retailer. He specializes in selling doors and windows. He established his business in 2006. He built a good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Hussain is requesting a sum of $2,400 as a loan to renovate his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop

loans.name: La Bienfaisance 2 (2) Group

texts.en:
Ada, age 32, is single with two children, ages 4 and 8, and a baby on the way! He has one child currently attending school. He is representing the La Bienfaisance 2 (2) group. Ada owns and operates a restaurant in his local community. He has had this restaurant for one year. He plans to use the loan to buy drinks, plates, and more silverware for his restaurant. His business strategy is to offer great customer service. When his customers arrive he serves them quickly and makes sure that they are satisfied with their meal. 

This is Ada's first loan from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. HOPE and his group are confident he will repay the loan. Ada hopes to modernize and continue to develop his restaurant as it grows. He wants his children to succeed in life and work in some kind of business.

loans.use: to pay for drinks, plates, and silverware.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married, and has an only child. Raed is the only provider of the family. 

Raed owns a small shop and specializes in selling men's shoes and accessories. After working with his father for a long time in the same shop, he decided to take over the business and continue in this path. He established his business in 2007. He built a good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Raed is requesting a sum of $3,000 as a loan to pay the yearly rent of his shop and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the yearly rent of his shop and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Le Tresor 2 Group

texts.en:
Ida is 50 years old and single with a 29-year-old child. For the past 10 years, she has sold clothing in a local market. Ida has gained valuable customers and her business strategy is to offer friendly and polite customer service. In Congo, used-clothing vendors buy large bales of clothing from a company that receives clothing from various places around the world. Ida sorts the clothes to sell. She has successfully repaid four previous loans from the Kiva partner HOPE Congo.

Ida is requesting a loan as a representative of the Le Tresor 2 group. She will use her portion of the loan to buy a large bale of used clothing. Ida wants to continue to improve her business and she hopes her child will be happy in life and find a job.

loans.use: to pay for a bale of used clothing

loans.name: Jehovah Jireh 2 Group

texts.en:
Marie is 53 and single with four children, ages 18 to 33 years old. Her youngest is currently attending school. For the past 10 years, Marie has sold a variety of products at a stand at the market. Her business strategy is to allow loyal and trustworthy customers to buy her merchandise on credit. This helps attracts new customers and keep older customers coming back to her business. Marie has successfully repaid five previous loans from the Kiva partner HOPE Congo.

Marie is requesting a loan as a representative of the Jehovah Jireh 2 group. She will use her portion of the loan to buy food products, such as oil, rice, and sugar, as well as hair styling products. In the future, Marie hopes to be able to have a large grocery store one day in its own building.

loans.use: to pay for food items and hair stying products

loans.name: La Bienfaisance 2 (1) Group

texts.en:
Seth, age 56, is married with 3 children, aged 14 to 30 years old. All 3 of his children are currently attending high school or college. 

He is representing the La Bienfaisance 2 (1) group. Seth has a small grocery market and has been operating it for over 20 years. He has gained valuable experience over the years, as well as many loyal customers. He will use the loan to buy oil, sugar, tomatoes, rice, and kerosene to sell in his store. His business strategy is to always have in stock what the customers want. He regularly asks his customers what items they prefer and tries to cater to their needs. 

Seth has received 3 previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He hopes to continue to progress and open another business in the future.

loans.use: to pay for oil, sugar, tomatoes, rice, and kerosene to sell at his market

loans.name: Jehovah Jireh 1 Group

texts.en:
Francoise is 49 and single with two children, ages 22 and 25 years old. Her children are both finished with high school and currently attending university. For the past 10 years, Francoise has sold various merchandise at a stand in a local market. She has successfully repaid five previous loans with the Kiva partner HOPE Congo. Her business strategy is to give a good price relative to the other prices around her in the market.

Francoise is requesting a loan as a representative of the Jehovah Jireh 1 group. She will use her portion of the loan to buy plastic products, plates, other kitchen items, and clothes. In the future, Francoise hopes to become a great businesswoman. She also hopes both of her children will finish their college studies.

loans.use: to pay for plastic products, kitchenware, and clothes

loans.name: Dieu Merci 1 Group

texts.en:
Virginie is 45 and single with two children, ages 18 and 19 years old. Both of her children are currently attending school. For the past 10 years, Virginie has sold a variety of food products at a stand at the local market.  Her business strategy is to offer friendly customer service and give a small "cadeau," or gift, to returning customers. Virginie has successfully repaid five previous loans from the Kiva partner HOPE Congo. 

Virginie is requesting a loan as a representative of the Dieu Merci 1 group. She will use her portion of the loan to buy foufou, bread, and canned goods to sell. Foufou is a white cornmeal-like food that is a staple in this region of the world.  Virginie would like to continue to expand and open a second business in the future.

loans.use: to pay for foufou, bread, and canned goods

loans.name: Momela Group

texts.en:
Merina, who is in her mid 30s, is married with two sons who are still going to school. She has been a food vendor for 12 years now. She works from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Merina's eleventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy a radio, TV set, mattress, bed, cupboard, and sofa set. She also used the loans to pay for school fees and cover household expenses; she has paid back all her loans successfully. She is expending a loan to buy more food to resell and to pay for school fees. She has a dream of owning a hotel.

Merina will share this loan with her loan group, "Momela", which has eleven members. These members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more food to resell and to pay for school fees

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 65 años es una mujer sabia. Vive en compañía de Andrés su esposo desde hace 45 años. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia, que adquirió hace 34 años.
Ella vive en compañía de sus hijos, pues tiene una casa muy amplia donde cada uno vive independientemente y así no se siente sola con su esposo. Su actividad principal es su tienda de comestibles que abrió desde hace 21 años, en todo este tiempo lo surtió muy bien tanto así que cuenta con clientes fijos. También cuenta con 4 vacas, un toro, gallinas y cuyes, los cuales vende o consume de acuerdo a su necesidad. Como nunca descansa por temporadas siembra maíz y cebada, pero la alfalfa lo realiza constantemente para el alimento de sus animales. Estas siembras lo venden a un comerciante mayorista que la visita muy seguido ya que conoce de la calidad de sus tierras, que descansan un año para volver a producir el alimento. Ahora desea mejorar su tienda de comestibles, pues sabe que no tendrá la misma fuerza cuando envejezca más y solo tendrá que dedicarse a su negocio para subsistir. 
Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “los emprendedores” y este es el crédito número 19  con MFP, por tanto agradece su apoyo, con el cual logrará cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, pues lleva muchos años de conocerlos.
María de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar por sacos.
texts.en:
María is 65 years old and a wise woman.  She lives with Andres, her husband of 45 years.  Together they have eight children, but they only live with two of them in their own house, which they bought 34 years ago.  She lives with her children, but they have a large house where everyone can live independently, and therefore she doesn't feel alone with her husband.  

She works at her grocery store, which she opened 21 years ago.  In all of this time, she has stocked it very well and has counted on loyal customers.  She also has four cows, a bull, chickens, and guinea pigs, which she sells or eats, depending on their needs.  Since she never rests, she seasonally plants corn and barley and grows alfalfa all year long to feed her animals.  She sells the crops to a wholesale buyer who visits often because he knows the quality of her land, which rests for a year before growing feed again.  

Now she wants to improve her grocery store, since she knows that she will not have the same energy as she gets older and will need to dedicate herself to her store to make a living.  She is a member of the community bank Los Emprendedores.  This is their 19th loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the support, which will allow her to meet her objectives. She promises to make her payments on time.  She is happy to be a part of her community bank because she has known them for many years.  Maria will use the requested loan to purchase staple products such as sacks of rice and sugar.

loans.use: to purchase staple items such as sacks of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is from Tirebe in Mombasa, Kenya's coastal region. She is 31 years of age and married wth three children, two of whom are still in school. 

She is the owner of a shop where she has been working for two years. She says that she's making headway with the business because she has been able to attract a good number of customers due to the fact that she always has a very well-stocked shop. She is a very enthusiastic person who wants to keep growing and investing in her business so that she can help with the household expenses.

Fatuma is asking for a loan amounting to KSH 30,000 to expand her business and invest in drinks, dairy products, bread, vegetables, and other products. This way, she can continue to provide her customers with a good variety of products and also attract new customers. She is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing items to sell in her shop

loans.name: Zid

texts.en:
Zid is 28 years old and married with two children. He is a youth client from Iraq and is the only provider for his family. In 2003, Zid established a small shop where he sells fruits and vegetables. He now has an employee and has gained good experience in this field. Zid is well-known in the surrounding area and has an excellent reputation.

Zid is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan to pay the yearly rent for his shop. In the future, his goal is to expand his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to pay a year's rent for his shop

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, tiene la edad de 41 años, está casado y vive con su esposa y los tres hijos actualmente. El quiere compra almacigo para la resiembra de su cafetal y también algunos insumos. El cuenta con el terreno y lo que quiere es resembrar las zonas más dañadas para así aumentar la cosecha próxima y crecer como un caficultor de la zona. El pretende con estas mejoras generar mayor producción de café y así también le genere ganancias para seguir adelante con su proyecto y mejorar su bienestar. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José is 41 years old, married, and lives with his wife and their three children.  He would like to purchase copperwood trees to replant his coffee fields and also some supplies.  He has land and he wants to replant the most damaged areas to increase their next harvest and grow as a coffee producer in his area.  He hopes these improvements will generate a larger coffee production and also earn him more income to continue with his project and improve his well-being.  

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR.  He has not had previous loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with the best facilities and low interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase copperwood trees and supplies.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
César, de 35 años es un hombre trabajador. Junto a Julia, su esposa desde hace 10 años; cuidan de sus 3 hijos en la casa que compró hace 9 años.  
“Me falta muchos objetivos por cumplir”, afirma. Aún no posee el dinero necesario para comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas, pero eso no lo desanima al contrario. Trabaja cada día con más esfuerzo, ahorrando lo que pueda para comprar uno. Ya tiene 7 años de experiencia en la siembra de papa, olluco, oca, mashua, cebada, habas y alverja. Cuenta que alquila terrenos de su comunidad, porque cuestan menos y de esa manera apoya en el crecimiento de sus pobladores. En cada cosecha aprovecha sus viajes a la capital para vender sus alimentos. Viaja 2 veces a la semana, llevando maca, alverja y papa; los cuales vende al menudeo en el mercado “la parada”, que es la más grande del país. Como es un hombre de campo, cuenta que posee 3 caballos y 3 burros los cuales utiliza como animales de carga para trasportar los fertilizantes hacia sus sembríos. “de esa manera me canso menos”, comenta.
Este es el sexto crédito con MFP y está contento de saber, que tendrá apoyo financiero, ya que se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su trabajo Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
César; invertirá el dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos de papa de la variedades “yungay, canchan, andina y huairo macho”.
texts.en:
Cesar is 35 years old and a hard-working man. Together with Julia, his wife of 10 years, he takes care of their 3 children in the house he bought nine years ago.
  
“I still have a lot of goals to achieve," says Cesar. He still does not have the money he needs to buy his own land for agriculture, but this hasn't discouraged him at all. To the contrary, he works harder every day, saving what he can to buy land in the future. 

He now has seven years of experience growing potato, ulluco, New Zealand yam, mashua, barley, broad beans, and peas. He rents land from his community because it costs less and in that way he can help support the growth of the community. After each harvest, he travels into the capital to sell his vegetables. He travels twice a week, taking mashua, peas, and potatoes, which he sells at retail in the "La Parada" market, the largest in the country. Because he is a framer, he also has three horses and three donkeys, which he uses as loading animals to transport fertilizers to the fields. "That way I am less tired," he says. 

This will be his sixth loan with MFP and he is happy to know he will have financial support because he is confident that he will progress with his work. He also promises to make his payments on time. He is thankful to be a part of his association because all of its members are responsible people and very supportive. Cesar will invest the money in buying natural fertilizers to spread over the various varieties of potato he grows, including yungay, canchan, andina, and huairo macho.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Gevork

texts.en: Gevork is 38 years old. He lives in the small village of Akhaltsikhe district with his wife and 2 children, who go to school. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. Besides that, Gevork owns a plot of land, where maize, haricot, and potatoes are grown. They sell the harvested products and cheese locally. Gevork is a very hardworking man and does his best to insure a good harvest. He requested a loan to purchase a milk cow. After purchasing an additional milk cow, they will produce and sell more cheese. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income, they will be able to improve their living conditions. Gevork awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Waukae Group

texts.en:
The borrower, who is in his early 30s, is married with one daughter who is still small. He has been selling airtime and recharging telephones since 2007.  He works from 6:00 AM to 10:00 PM daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to cover household expenses and to put his shop in good order by adding more shelves. He also sells some food, like vitumbuwa, mandazi, small cakes, sweets, biscuits, water, and juice, and has paid back all his loans successfully. He asks for another loan to increase his business products.

He will share this loan with his loan group, "WAUKAE", with 10 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on his business products

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is 31 years old and married. She is from the village of Vedreba, in the Kareli district where she lives with her family: her husband, three children, parents-in-law, and a retired grandmother. Natia’s husband and father-in-law are truck drivers who transport sand and also wood from the forest to sell to villagers. Together, Natia’s family manages the agricultural land that they own. They grow garlic and apple and sell the harvested products at the local open market.

Natia is requesting a loan to change the tires and motor oil on their truck. The old tires are in bad condition and are dangerous for her husband and father-in-law. Her loan will allow Natia’s husband to continue his job safely and a earn monthly income. In the future, the family will work to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to change tires and motor oil of her truck

loans.name: Muyayi Central Group

texts.en:
Robai is a member of Muyayi central Group in Bungoma South District. She is pictured with 14 One Acre Fund farmers, eight women and six men. Robai is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. Robai first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2005 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Robai joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices of fertilizer and hybrid seeds as well as learn more about proper farming.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Robai was only able to harvest ½ bags of maize per 1 acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest 10 bags per ½ acre! She plans on using future profits from the harvest to save for the future and send her children to school. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Robai's group will receive seven acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 49 years old and married with two children. He is the only provider for his family. Since 2011, Ahmad has operated a small grocery store where he sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents, and snacks. He has gained good experience in this field and is well-known in the surrounding area. Ahmad has an excellent reputation.

Ahmad is requesting a 3,000 USD loan to pay the yearly rent of his grocery store. In the future, he plans to increase his business and his profits to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay a year's rent for his grocery store

loans.name: Fronterizas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FRONTERIZAS”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Carolina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de toallas, restaurante de comida, hilado y trenzado de mantas, venta de calcetines, venta de comida, venta de artículos varios.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Carolina es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de las compañeras de su grupo que son socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida (pensión); cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió de hace cinco años con el apoyo de sus padres.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de mesas, sillas) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The Fronterizas community bank will start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata regional community center.  The group has six members and is led by a board where Carolina is the president.  The businesses the members have are varied, including: towel sales, a restaurant, knitted and braided blankets, sock sales, food sales, and sale of various items.  

This loan will benefit small businesswomen like Carolina.  She said that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for five years.  She joined this group by invitation of her friends who were members of the institution.  She has a business selling food (making set meals each day).  She started the business five years ago with the support of her parents.

Carolina will use this loan to purchase tables and chairs.  She will purchase them at the market in the city of El Alto and later will put them in her sales area.  This type of work will allow her to generate income to support her family, since she is single and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said she likes the meetings and being able to save.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs.

loans.name: Flor De Haba Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE HABA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Natty es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de ropa de bebe, artesanía en muñequería para exportar, venta de cuadernos empastados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Natty es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa de bebe; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su cuñada que comercializaba estos productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de frazadas de bebe) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud.

En la fotografía acompaña la hija de la señora Genara, quien esta vestida de rosado.
texts.en:
The group “Flor de Haba” will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center. It has six members and is managed by a board of directors of which Natty is President. The members of the group are involved in various businesses, which include: knitting baby clothes, handmade dolls for export, and the sale of bound notebooks.

The loan they are requesting will benefit micro-entrepreneurs of which Natty is a member. She says that this is her first time with Pro Mujer, joining after a friend who is a member of the institution invited her. Currently, she has a business selling baby clothes. She learned the business from a sister-in-law who also sells the products. 

The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital (by buying baby blankets) that she will buy from distributor companies and later sell at the markets in El Alto city. This work allows her to generate income to support her family as much as she can, as she is married and has a son. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said she enjoys the health education they provide.

In the photograph, she is joined by the daughter of Mrs. Genara who is dressed in pink.

loans.use: Buy baby blankets.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a buffalo for their livestock and dairy business.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred used the previous loan to buy rice and sugar to sell. He is a twenty-five-year-old hardworking man with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children and build a permanent home.

He has been operating a retail shop for four years now. Alfred started with capital of 2,500,000 only and now his business is worth 6,000,000. The major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, and inadequate capital to purchase enough stock. However, he has a vision of expanding his business to new markets and diversifying his business to include farming and a hardware shop.

Alfred intends to use the loan to buy iron sheets and cement for resale.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets and cement for resale.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es: La  Sra. Ramona tiene 50 años, tiene un hijito de la edad de 10 años que se encuentra en edad escolar, La Sra. Ramona se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, dulces, refrescos y variedad de artículos en su tienda de barrio que se encuentra en la zona Bajo Pampahasi,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La  Sra. Ramona va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de abarrotes para surtir su negocio como arroz, fideo, harina y azúcar por mayor para surtir su tienda  y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, La  Sra. Ramona va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, ya que esta época de carnavales es de mucha demanda,  su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela, la Sra. Ramona se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Ramona is 50 years old and has a ten year old son who is school aged.  Ramona works selling a variety of basic items such as groceries, candy, soft drinks, and other home products at her neighborhood store, which is located in the Bajo Pampahasi area. 

This loan is her first with Emprender.  She plans to use the loan to purchase a variety of groceries at wholesale to stock her store such as rice, pasta, flour, and sugar.  This will allow her to provide a larger variety of products to her customers.  She is requesting the loan to continue improving her business.  

Ramona will use the profits to continue purchasing products and therefore improve her income.  Since it is Carnival time, her products are very in demand.  She hopes her business will have a larger space so that she can provide better service to her customers.  Ramona feels happy with the opportunity provided since this is the only work that will allow her to support herself.

loans.use: to purchase rice, flour, and sugar for her store.

loans.name: Abejitas De Tilata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ABEJITAS DE TILATA”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de tela, venta de comida, venta de víveres, taller de costura, venta de cosméticos, venta de gelatinas, tienda de barrio, venta de lubricantes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nora es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió al ver la carencia de este negocio en su zona, mismo que era necesario para ella y sus vecinos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fideos, azúcar, arroz, etc.) que adquirirá de los mercados de la Ciudad de El Alto, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
The group “Abejitas de Tilata” will begin its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Dela Focal Center. It has eight members and is managed by a board of directors of which Nora is President. The members are involved in various business adventures, including: fabric sales, food sales, the sale of provisions, a sewing workshop, cosmetic sales, gelatine sales, a general store, and the sale of lubricants.

The loan requested will benefit micro-entrepreneurs of which Nora is a member. Nora says she joined Pro Mujer ten years ago after a friend who is a member of the institution invited her. Currently, Nora runs a general store, which she opened after seeing that there wasn't one in her neighborhood, and which she and her neighbors needed. 
 
She will invest the loan in increasing her capital by buying noodles, sugar, rice, etc. that she will buy at wholesale at the markets in El Alto city and later sell in her store. This work allows her to generate income to support her family as best she can, as she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Nora said she likes the savings.

loans.use: buy noodles, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a 34-year-old married man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda with his three children aged 7, 4 and 2.

Andrew works in the transport business with 10 years of experience as a taxi driver. He started as a hired driver and later bought his own taxi for which he has paid half of the cost. He has problems of poor roads and vehicle breakdowns leading to high repair costs, coupled with high fuel and transportation costs.

He has a personal goal of building a permanent house and business goal of expanding his business into new market areas. Andrew is requesting the loan to complete paying for the taxi.

loans.use: to complete paying for the taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ghee and sugar for a sweetmeat making and selling business.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA ESPERANZA II”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Felisa es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas de hilo, tienda surtida, carnicería, venta de cerveza, tejido de chalecos, costura de enaguas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Felisa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas y chalecos; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su hermana y posteriormente decide implementar su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The communal bank “NUEVA ESPERANZA II” (NEW HOPE II”) will begin the first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Copacabana. It is composed of eight members and it is directed by a board of directors where Felisa is the Treasurer. The businesses carried out by the members of the communal association are varied, among them are: linen blanket fabrics, a well-stocked shop, a butcher shop, a beer vendor, fabrics for vests, and petticoat stitching.

The loan taken benefits small micro-entrepreneurs where Felisa is a member. She indicates that it is the first time that she joined Pro Mujer, joining by invitation from a promoter of the institution who went to visit her at her house. At the present time she has a blankets and vests fabric business; she says that she learned this business from her sister and later she decided to set up her own business.

The loan that she will now take is to increase capital (wool purchase) that she will buy at the fairs in the city of El Alto, wholesale, and later make her products which she will sell in her stall. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family, since she is single and has a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the saving.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Fatuma, 29, is married with four children aged three, six, eight and ten. Three of her children are in school. She is from Msambweni Mombasa. Fatuma is a very hardworking person who has always worked and striven to reach her goals and objectives. She wakes up early in the morning and returns very late in the evening.

Fatuma owns a food stall near her home. She has it stocked with fruits and vegetables to compliment the food she prepares and sells to her customers. She has had the stall for more than three years and now she has gained trust from customers. Therefore, she needs to expand her business and that is why she has requested this loan amounting to 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

Fatuma is grateful for this opportunity which she is getting that she believes will help very much.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Wastara Group

texts.en:
Latifa, who is in her late 30s, is married with two sons who are still in school. She has been a food vendor since 2002. She works from 6am to 9pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Latifa's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy the missing items in her food stock and soft drinks, pay school fees, buy a mattress and bed and cover household expenses. She has paid back all her loans successfully. Latifa wants a loan to pay school fees and to increase her food stock so as to sell to more people.

Latifa will share this loan with her loan group, Wastara, which has 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to pay school fees and to increase her food stock so as to sell to more people.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 43 años, tiene un hijito de la edad de 8 años, ella se dedica a la venta de comida almuerzo y pollo a la broaster su pensión se encuentra en un de las calles concurridas de la zona de Villa Fátima,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Maria va a usar este préstamo para compra de insumos por mayor, como abarrotes y hortalizas para la elaboración de sus platillos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo la falta de efectivo para la compra de insumos,  la Sra. Maria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las condiciones climáticas y también la competencia  de los demás negocios de comida por lo mismo que tiene que tratar de reducir sus costos y mejorar su sazón   de sus platillos, y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de utensilios  y también en la ampliación de la misma para poder captar más clientes en las horas pico de almuerzo y cena, la Sra. Maria es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por esta oportunidad brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Maria is 43 years old and has an eight year old son.  She works selling lunches and broasted chicken from her stand in one of the streets within the Villa Fátima zone of the city.  This loan is her second with this lender.  She will use this credit to buy supplies in bulk, like groceries and vegetables, for the creation of the dishes she offers. Her reason for requesting this loan is a lack of capital for purchasing supplies.  Maria faces challenges in her business, including the weather and competition from other food vendors.  For this reason she needs to try to reduce her costs and improve the seasoning of her dishes.  She will use the benefits of the purchase of these implements and the development of them to be able to bring in more clients during the peak hours for lunch and dinner.  Maria is a very hard-working person.  She is happy for the opportunity provided by the granting of this line of credit.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make lunches and broasted chicken.

loans.name: Benadatte

texts.en:
Benadatte is a 33-year-old single mother of four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is a tea farmer alongside being a primary teacher, where she is paid very little salary. Benadatte solely takes full responsibility for the three orphans of her biological brother in addition to her four children. She has a challenge of the price fluctuation of tea and inadequate capital to buy farm inputs (fertilizers, etc.).

She is very committed towards educating her children up to the university level and also desires to expand her plantation. Benadatte is requesting a loan to buy manure and pay workers who are helping her out in her tea plantation.

loans.use: to buy manure and pay workers who are helping her out in her tea plantation

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Solidarias Group

texts.es:
DUO MUJERES SOLIDARIAS
Este dúo lo forma doña Rosa María quien es la líder del grupo y nos cuenta que ella se dedica a la elaboración de comales de barro hace mas de 18 años y  como también se dedica a la venta de periódico por libra,y tambien se dedica a la venta de produtos comestibles de consumo diario ya que por donde vive es un producto vendible durante todo el año, además quiere seguir apoyando a sus hijos que van a seguir estudiando tiene 4 hijos y 2 de ellos ya van a estudiar educación media  desea que algún día obtengan un grado superior al que ella no tuvo la oportunidad, también desea salir a vender a los pueblos cercanos a su comunidad y poder tener mayor ingreso de sus ganancias, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles de consumo diario.
texts.en: The communal bank "Duo Mujeres Solidarias" has two members.  Rosa Maria is the leader of the group.  She tells us that she has been making clay griddles for more than 18 years, and she also sells newspapers by the pound and staple food products, because these products can be sold during the whole year.  Rosa Maria wants to continue to support her children, who are going to continue with their education.  She has 4 children, 2 of whom are already in high school.  Rosa Maria wants them to get a college education, which is something that she never got the opportunity to do.  Also, she wants to go out to sell in the towns that are close to her community so that she could have more income from her sales.  Rosa Maria is requesting this loan to buy staple food products to sell.

loans.use: to buy staple food products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap, rice, salt and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 50-year-old married woman with five children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She operates a retail shop for clothes and shoes alongside maize farming. She started with a family contribution and over time her business has picked up. She has the challenges of customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to meet the people’s demands. She is very committed towards educating her children and expanding her farming activities. Florence is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child

loans.name: Kimoyi Group

texts.en:
Susy is a member of Kimoyi Group in Bungoma South District. She is pictured with 14 One Acre Fund farmers, 11 women and 3 men. Susy is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ an acre of maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. Susy first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Susy joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Susy was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize per ½ acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest 10 bags per ½ acre! She plans on using future profits from the harvest to save for the future and perhaps invest in another business.

During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Susy's group will receive 7 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a 29-year-old hardworking married man with 2 children aged 1 and 6 living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. He acquired his start-up capital from banana farming. He opened up a retail shop for general merchandise to serve the people in his village and the surrounding areas.

Alex is a very honest business man but has a challenge of inadequate capital and the problem of price fluctuations due to inflation, hence high prices for the commodities. In future he wants to become a wholesaler and has a personal goal of building a permanent home for his family. Alex is requesting a loan for purchasing sugar, soap, rice, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap, rice, salt and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 35-year-old hardworking married man with five children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. John operates a men’s salon, working for at least seven hours a day, alongside being a mechanic in his garage. He acquired his start-up capital by doing motor vehicle, motorcycle and bicycle repairs. His dream is to have a modern salon so as to attract more customers, but he has inadequate capital. John is requesting a loan to purchase shaving machines, mirrors and chairs for the salon.

loans.use: to purchase shaving machines, mirrors and chairs for his salon

loans.name: Jose Urias

texts.es: José Urias vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, él es un empleado de empresa privada y trabaja como maestro de obra, tiene varios años de experiencia  y eso le ha dado la oportunidad de obtener siempre las mejores ganancias, su trabajo es muy demandado y es uno de los mejores trabajadores del lugar; José es un hombre entregado a su labor, dispuesto a dar todo de su parte para cumplir sus sueños lo mas impórtate en su vida es su familia y en las ultimas semanas el deterioro de su vivienda ha incomodado la tranquilidad de su hogar, la casa necesita reparaciones y quiere realizarlas lo mas pronto posible para la seguridad de todos, su mas grande secreto es la perseverancia, sabe que así alcanzara el éxito, necesita invertir pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, ladrillos, herramientas etc. José Urias tiene buenas referencias de pago y se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jose Urias lives with his life partner and their children.  He works for a private company as a master builder.  He has a number of years of experience, and this has given him the opportunity to increase his earnings.  There is a lot of demand for his work, as he is one of the best workers in the place.  Jose is a man who is devoted to his work.  He is ready to give his all so that he can accomplish his dreams.  His family is the most important thing in his life, and in recent weeks, the deterioration of his house has interrupted the tranquility of his household.  His house needs repairs, and he wants to do them as soon as possible for the safety of all.  Jose's biggest secret is perseverance; he knows that this is how to achieve success.  He needs to invest, but he lacks the capital, and so this is why he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow him to buy cement, bricks, tools, etc.  Jose Urias has good credit references, and he accepts the responsibility of paying off the debt.  Also, he has hopes that he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, and tools

loans.name: Emma

texts.es: Emma  vive junto hijo y en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas en el lugar de su residencia, tiene varios años de trabajar con el pequeño negocio y ha adquirido experiencia valiosa que le permite agilizar la producción de tortillas, gracias al buen manejo de la venta siempre obtiene las mejores ganancias, la comunidad donde vive es muy transitada y ya tiene mucha clientela, aunque sus mejores clientes son los vecinos, todo la prefieren porque su producto es de calidad, a un precio accesible y sobre todo con el servicio mas rápido del lugar; Emma es una mujer activa, decidida y muy dedicada a su labor, desea salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños por eso todos los días se esfuerza al máximo en el trabajo pues sabe que solo así alcanzara el éxito que tanto espera, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, leña, etc. Emma tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Emma lives with her son in her own home. She sells tortillas from her home. She has been working in this small business for several years and has acquired valuable experience which has allowed her to speed up the production of tortillas. Thanks to good sales management, she gets the best profits. The community where she lives is very busy and she already has many customers. Although her best customers are her neighbours, everyone prefers her because her product is of good quality, affordable and above all the quickest service. Emma is an active and determined woman who is very dedicated to her work. She wants to move forward and fulfill her dreams and every day she puts maximum effort in her work as she knows that this is the only way she can achieve success which she really hopes.

In recent weeks demand has increased and she wants to take advantage of it for a new investment however, she doesn't have enough capital and that is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy corn wholesale, firewood, etc... 

Emma has good payment references and is very responsible. She ensures that she will be able to get out of debt and she has faith that she will bring economic security to her home.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale, and firewood.

loans.name: Lutaso Group

texts.en:
Florence is a member of the Lutaso Group in Bungoma South District. She is pictured with 10 One Acre Fund farmers, 8 women and 2 men. Florence is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. Florence first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Florence joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices and grow enough food for her family.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Florence was only able to harvest ½ bag of maize per 1 acre, but after joining One Acre Fund, during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest 8 bags per ½ acre! She plans on using future profits from the harvest to save for the future and perhaps invest in another business. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Florence’s group will receive 5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

Beatrice and Everlyne, members of Lutaso Group, are pictured above. However, they have already appeared on Kiva. In order to prevent the double funding of a farmer, they are pictured as members of the group, but will not receive funding from this loan.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Shaheen's Group

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 43-year-old hard-working woman. She lives in Pakistan with her husband, two sons and two daughters. Her Husband is a government employee. One of her daughters is married and the remaining three children are students.

Her husband's income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Shaheen is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes at home.
Since 2009 she has been operating her tailoring business very efficiently, but she is currently in need of purchasing a new sewing machine, as her old machine is not working properly.

At this moment she has requested a loan as a member of a 7-person lending group from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so she can continue her business. With the profits she will pay the household expenses and put aside some savings for further business expansion.
Note: In the picture Shaheen is carrying a pass book in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine for stitching clothes.

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en: Ezra is a 47-year-old, married man with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been in the cocoa business for 10 years. He also has a side business of second-hand clothes. He hopes to have a good family house in the future and expand his cocoa plantation despite challenges of unpredictable seasonal weather changes and limited finances. The purpose of the loan is to buy materials such as sand and cement to complete his house.

loans.use: to buy materials such as sand and cement to complete his house.

loans.name: Givi

texts.en:
Givi lives in the village of Osiauri, Khashuri District, East Georgia. He is 53 years old and has a large family: his wife, three children, daughter-in-law, infant grandson and a retired mother. Givi is leading the agricultural business of the family. They own two milk cows and sell dairy products at a nearby town's open market. The family grows maize, potatoes, haricots and onions on family-owned agricultural land. Besides this, he produces hay and sells it for a good price. 

Along with the family's agricultural business, Givi is also involved in a trading business. He owns a small grocery store in his village and sells different kinds of groceries to the villagers. 

Givi requested credit for purchasing sheep. He will start selling lambs and using the milk from the sheep to produce cheese which will be sold at the nearby town's open market as well. The income of the family will increase. In the future, Givi plans to reinvest part of his income in the sheep breeding business for its further development. The rest will be used to improve the daily living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Yonie

texts.en: Yonie is 49 years old and lives in Montserrado County, in the area of Jacob Town, which is one of the cheaper places to live in Montserrado County. She is a widow and has three children between 28 and 38 which live on their own. For twenty years now she has been selling used clothes at the local market, most interestingly her business helped her gain more money for herself. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She plans to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en: Oretha is 44 years old and lives in Jacob Town, one of the cheaper places to live in Montserrado. She is married with 8 children between the ages of 15 and 20, which are attending school, and live at home. For the past 15 years she has been selling biscuits, soap, rice, pepper, soft drinks and oil in the local market. She makes more profit at some times, but most of the time business is slow. She is requesting a loan to purchase biscuits, soap, rice, pepper, soft drink, and oil for her business. Her plan for the future is to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, soap, rice, pepper, soft drinks, and oil for her business.

loans.name: Ndengelwa Group

texts.en:
Margaret is a member of the Ndengelwa Group in Bungoma South District. She is pictured with 10 One Acre Fund farmers, 9 women and 1 man. Margaret is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. Margaret first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2009 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Margaret joined One Acre Fund in order to access and grow enough food for her family.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Margaret was only able to harvest 1.5 bags of maize per ½ acre, but after participating with the One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest 6 bags per ½ acre! She plans on using future profits from the harvest to save for the future and perhaps buy a cow. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Margaret's group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a 40-year-old single mother with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the clothing business for four years and her business is located in the market. With the proceeds she has been able to acquire a rental house so as to earn additional income. She is a good mother and desires to educate her children up to the University level while her business plan is to own a modern boutique. Annet intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel vive junto a su compañera de vida  y su hijo en casa propia. El posee un taller de  carpintería elabora y tapiza muebles de diferentes tipos, tiene varios años con el negocio y posee mucha experiencia valiosa que le permite realizar bien su trabajo y al mimo tiempo obtiene muy buenas ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico que califico como excelente para sus actividades, tiene mucha clientela y últimamente ha aumentado la demanda pues todo  lo realiza de primera calidad y  a precios accesibles, además el servicio es excelente siempre recibe a las personas con una enorme sonrisa en el rostro; Miguel es un hombre trabajador dispuesto a salir adelante y triunfar, tiene muchas metas por alcanzar, una de ellas es ver crecer su negocio para mantenerse adelante de la competencia, piensa que los campeones no se hacen en gimnasios, están hechos de algo inmaterial que tienen muy dentro de ellos, es un deseo, un sueño, una visión, pensando así es como se decido a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar un lote de madera, etc. Miguel Ángel tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable asegura saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la certeza que así podrá llevar seguridad económica a su hogar.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel lives with his life partner and child in his own house.  He has a furniture shop where he makes and upholsters different types of furniture.  He has had the business for several years and has a lot of valuable experience that allows him to do his job well.  At the same time he earns very good profits.

The business is in a very strategic location that he describes as excellent for his activities.  He has a lot of customers and lately demand has increased because everything he makes is of high quality at an affordable price.  In addition, his service is excellent: he always greets people with a huge smile on his face.

Miguel's a hardworking man who's ready to get ahead and triumph.  He has many goals to reach, one of which is to see his business grow so he can stay ahead of the competition.  He thinks that champions aren't made in gymnasiums but of something intangible they have deep inside of themselves: it's a desire, a dream, a vision.

Thinking this way is how he decided to ask Integral for a loan that will allow him to buy a load of wood, etc.

Miguel Ángel has a good payment record and impeccable morals.  He's certain he'll repay the debt as well as be able to bring financial security to his household.

loans.use: to buy a load of wood

loans.name: Adrian Alonso

texts.es:
Adrián de 29 años de edad, reside en la vereda San Luis del municipio de Támesis, Colombia con su esposa. Creció en el seno de una familia campesina, por lo cual ha sido agricultor desde fu infancia. En la actualidad busca como ganarse la vida para sostener a su familia, razón por la cual se dedica a la agricultura y a prestar el servicio de moto-taxi.

Su faena comienza a las cinco de la mañana con el cuidado de cerdos  y posteriormente se dedica al transporte de pasajeros. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de concentrado para el engorde de sus porcinos y realizar reparaciones en los corrales. Espera que con esta inversión su calidad de vida mejore y pueda brindarle a su familia mejores oportunidades de vida.
texts.en:
Adrián, 29 years old, lives in the San Luis district of the municipality of Támesis, Colombia with his wife. He grew up in the bosom of a country family, so he has been a farmer since he was a child. Currently, he is looking to earn a living in order to support his family, which is why he farms and offers a motorcycle taxi service. 

His work starts at five in the morning with taking care of the pigs, and then he transports passengers. Currently he is asking for a loan to buy animal feed to fatten his pigs and to make repairs to the pens. He hopes that with this investment his quality of life will improve and he can provide his family with better life opportunities.

loans.use: to buy animal feed to fatten pigs

loans.name: Muyayi North Group

texts.en:
Teresa is a member of Muyayi North Group in Bungoma South District. She is pictured with 10 One Acre Fund farmers — six women and four men. Teresa is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for half an acre of maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. Teresa first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2006 Long Rains season and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Teresa joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices of fertilizer and hybrid seeds as well as to learn more about proper farming.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Teresa was only able to harvest 1.5 bags of maize per 1 acre, but after One Acre Fund's Long Rains 2012 season, she was able to harvest eight bags per half acre! She plans on using future profits from the harvest to save for the future and send her children to school. 

During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive half an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Teresa's group will receive 5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: Constance is 26 years old and lives in the Jacob Town area. That is one of the cheaper places to live in Montserrado County. She’s single and she is an 8th grade student. She has been involved in the sale of rice, oil, pepper, vita, etc., for past three years. She started this business with the help of her boyfriend, who give her some money. Her main challenge is that the price of goods is too high. She has requested this loan to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, vita, etc., to resell. She hopes to build her own house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, vita, etc., to resell.

loans.name: Jutoe

texts.en: Jutoe is 42 years old and lives in Montrserrado County, which produced the most fish in the Liberian market; she is married and has 7 children between the ages of 2 and 25. Only five of them live at home and all of them are attending school. For the past two years she has been selling fresh fish in the community market. She started this business by selling fish for her mother. She is requesting a loan to buy more fish for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Nazir's Group

texts.en:
Nazir is a 57-year-old independent woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. She has 3 daughters and 3 sons. Two of her sons are working in a restaurant and rest of her children are students.

Nazir as a member of 5-person lending group has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase one more tailoring machine for her business. By purchasing this machine, she will be able to fulfill her customers' demand. This will help her to increase her net income and to increase her customers as well. 

With the profit from this loan, she wants to provide a quality education to her children.

Note: In the photo, Nazia is holding a pass book in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase one more tailoring machine for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Julio Daniel

texts.es:
Julio de 54 años de edad, originario de Managua, soltero, padre de 3 hijos entre las edades de 21, 33 y 35 años, actualmente solo el menor estudia la carrera universitarias de administración de empresas, los otros dos ya terminaron de estudiar, de oficio comerciante, es dueño de una pulpería del que es propietario hace más de 3 años. Inicio su actividad laboral  a la edad de 50 años, con capital propio, dinero que obtuvo de su liquidación de su antiguo trabajo, fue allí que decidió emprender su propio negocio de pulpería, el cual le resulta muy rentable y a la vez le genera muchas ganancias a diarias, cuenta con otros ingresos  como es las remesas que le envían sus hijos. Sus  expectativas es ampliar su pulpería. 
Él está solicitando el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, lapicero, cuadernos, gaseosa, etc. Todos los productos que necesita para surtir aún más su pulpería, ya que él piensa que este crédito le ayudaría a crecer en inventarios,  con el  propósito  de incrementar sus ventas , para obtener mejores ganancias, una de sus metas es acondicionar la infraestructura del local en donde tiene su negocio para dar una mejor presentación.
texts.en:
Julio is 54 years old; originally from Managua; single; and the father of three children aged 21, 33, and 35. Currently his youngest child is studying business administration in university. The other two have finished studying and are also in business. Julio is the manager of a grocery store which he has owned for the last three years. He started working in this business when he was 50 years old using his own capital which he obtained in the liquidation of his previous work. It was then that he decided to launch his own business, the grocery store, which has proven very profitable and at the same time generates sufficient daily earnings. He has other sources of income, such as the remittances that his children send him. He hopes to expand the store. 

Julio is asking for this loan in order to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, pens, notebooks, soda, etc - all of the products he needs to stock his store even more. He hopes this loan will help him to increase his inventory and in turn increase his sales and his earnings. 

One of his goals is set up the building where he has his store in order to give his store a better presentation.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, pens, notebooks, soda, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Linda

texts.es: Rosa se dedica a la comercialización de golosinas heladas en su casa de habitación, ella vive junto a tres hijos menores de edad, quienes estudian y trabajan, brindándole una ayuda a su madre con los gastos del hogar. Rosa vende paletas artesanales de diferentes sabores de frutas, así mismo vende sorbetes en cono y vasitos, el negocio es estable  y sus ventas se incrementan los fines de semana. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el fin de poder comprar mayor cantidad de paletas de sombrillita, nombre con el cual se le conoce en el país a las paletas hechas artesanalmente, que son las que más demanda poseen por ser de bajo costo y tener variedad de sabores, lo que Rosa hará con dicho préstamo, así mismo podrá comprar mayor cantidad de sorbetes, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en: Rosa sells frozen sweets in her house. She lives with her three minor children, who study and work, providing some help to their mother with the household expenses. Rosa sells traditionally-made ice pops of various fruit flavors, as well as sorbets in cones and small cups. The business is stable, and her sales increase on the weekend. She is asking for a loan from Integral for the purpose of being able to buy a greater quantity of "sombrillita" ("little umbrella") ice pops. Ice pops made in the traditional way are known by this name in her country. They are in the greatest demand because they are low cost and there are a variety of flavors. This is what Rosa will do with the loan, and she will also be able to buy a greater quantity of sorbets, which will allow her to improve her sales.

loans.use: to purchase ice pops and sorbets to sell

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
Cándida de 50 años de edad, originaria de Chontales, pero actualmente vive en Managua, casada, madre de 4 hijos mayores de edad, todos son independiente, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de mercadería variada. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio hace 18 años  comercializando productos varios, con capital propio, dinero que tenía ahorrado, de esta manera pudo establecer su propio negocio de venta de productos varios como gaseosa, pan, jugo, leche, papel higiénicos y jabón, del cual se siente satisfecha porque ha logrado incrementar sus ventas, de esta manera ha podido salir adelante con las ganancias que le genera su negocio a diarios, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de su hija, sus expectativas es expandir el negocio con mercadería variada que aún no tiene en inventario.
