texts.en: Alisher lives in the Hamadoni Region. He is 41 years old. He is married, with three children. Alisher is a car mechanic. He rents a shop where he provides tire vulcanization services. He has been working in this business for two years. He is taking out a loan to buy a wheel balancer and tools.

loans.use: to buy a wheel balancer and car repair tools.

loans.name: Kanayim

texts.ru: Канаиым 47 лет. Образование у Канаиым среднее. В течении уже многих лет  Канаиым является руководителем программы по совершенствованию системы здравоохранения в селе . Единственный сын живет с Канаыим он и является основным помощником мамы.  Младшая дочка учится в лицеи и проживает с ними, в свободное от школы время дочь помогает маме. Старшие две дочери обустроены и имеют свои собственные семьи. По характеру она очень приятная и отзывчивая женщина. Еще до развала СССР 30 лет назад семья начала занимается сельским хозяйством. Сейчас семья выращивает скот и занимается полеводством. Совокупный годовой доход семьи составляет около 240,000 KGS Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Канаиым обратилась в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков и овец. На прибыль от кредита планирует дать образование внукам.
texts.en:
Kanayim is 47 years old and has a secondary education.  For many years already, she has been the director of her village's public health care program.  Her only son lives with her and happens to be her main helper.  She also has three daughters: the youngest lives with her.  She is a secondary school student who helps her mother during her spare time.  Kanayim's two older daughters are now independent and have their own families.

By nature, Kanayim is a pleasant and kindhearted woman.  Her family became involved in farming 30 years ago, even before the collapse of the Soviet Union.  The family now raises livestock and cultivates field crops.  The family's total yearly income comes close to 240,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her business, Kanayim has turned to "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 135,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of young bulls and sheep.  She plans to use the profits from this loan to pay for her grandchildren's education.

loans.use: to purchase bulls and sheep.

loans.name: Pardaboy

texts.ru: Пардабою 38 лет. Он женат. У него четыре детей. Супруга Пардабоя умеет вышивать национальные женские одежды. Однако у нее нет швейной машины. Пардабой хотел бы помочь жене в открытии бизнеса, так как вышивание прибыльное дело в нашей стране. Для этого он обратился за кредитом. На полученный кредит Пардабой собирается приобрести швейную машину. За счет прибыли с деятельности жены Пардабой планирует сделать долгожданный ремонт в доме.
texts.en: Pardaboy is 38 years old. He is married and has four children. Pardaboy's wife knows how to embroider traditional women's clothing. However, she  has no sewing machine. Pardaboy would like to help his wife launch a business since embroidery is a profitable occupation in [Tajikistan]. This is why he has applied for a loan. He plans to use a loan to buy a sewing machine. Pardaboy plans to use the revenues from his wife's business in order to make some long awaited home renovations.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Abumuslim

texts.ru:
Абумуслим проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 30 лет. Он холост. Абумуслим жизнерадостный и отзывчивый молодой человек. Он любит трудится и зарабатывать своим трудом. 
Вот уже два года как Абумуслим занимается растениеводством. Он арендует участок земли, которую обрабатывает и сеет зернобобовые культуры, овощи. Абумуслим берет кредит для закупа семян, минеральных удобрений и топлива.
texts.en:
Abumuslim lives in the Hamadoni district.  He is 30 years old and single.  He is a cheerful and kindhearted young man who loves to work and to earn a living through his hard work.

He has been involved in agriculture for two years already.  He cultivates a parcel of land which he rents and on which he grows legumes and vegetables.  He is taking a loan to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita, 51 years of age, is married. They were blessed with seven children. 

Carmencita is a vegetable vendor in the village of San Luis. When she sells, she earns a net income of PHP 5,000 every month. 

Carmencita requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase vegetables to sell. Her income usually goes to the family’s daily expenditures. She's hoping that her requested loan amount will be granted so that she will be able to gain more income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell in their village.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
This is Gloria. Her previous loan was a big help, not just in her business, but also in her daily expenses. She was able to buy all the needed products for her grocery store, and that helped a lot in generating more income. Her business has been running for fifteen years now, and it keeps on growing. She is working hard to provide income for her everyday expenses.

Gloria would like to apply for another loan, this time for 40,000 PHP, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gloria hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams of having a good and peaceful life. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a business-oriented woman. She is happily married with two children. Delia manages a general store and carinderia in her neighborhood.

Delia has run her carinderia for ten years and her general store for one. She is thankful because the types of food she sells are very popular. She and her spouse work together to invest in a motorcycle transport business. Their income goes toward household expenses, monthly payments for electric bills, and two single motor bikes.

Delia hopes to re-stock her general store and buy raw meat and vegetables for her carinderia business. She is seeking additional capital of 5,000 PHP. Using this loan, she wants to further increase her sales, which will enable her to provide for her family's daily necessities and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy stock and supplies for her grocery and food sales business.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth, 36, is married and blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a vegetable farm in her village for almost 13 years, where she plants a variety of vegetables such as string beans, eggplants, tomatoes, and squash. When harvest season comes, she will deliver her vegetables to the public market. Janeth is earns a net income of 5,000 PHP every month. Her monthly net income usually goes to her children's allowances. 

Janeth is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase vegetable seedlings and fertilizers. She's hoping the loan will help her improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Hotamqul

texts.ru:
Хотамкул мужчина в возрасте  42 лет, он женат и имеет   троих  детей.  Он  занимается животноводством с юности так как в свое время не смог получить образования. У него с детства в семье были финансовые проблемы, поэтому он вынужден заниматься только животноводством. Его дети уже подросли и им необходимо обзаводиться своими семьями и Хотамкул старается копить денежные средства чтобы купить приданное. 
 Сейчас у него несколько голов скота и до весны он хочет купить еще несколько, так как весной скот подорожает и он сможет продать по дороже и соответственно таким образом  увеличит свой капитал. Хотамкул очень надеется на финансовую поддержку от организации Кива, так как это единственное решение его планов. Он очень рад,что благодаря таким организациям как Кива люди имеющие финансовые проблемы могут решить их и осуществить свои планы.
На полученный кредит Хотамкул планирует купить скот и корм для скота.
texts.en:
Hotamqul is 42 years old, married, and the father of three children.  He did not have the opportunity to get an education and has been involved in animal husbandry since his youth.  When he was growing up, his family had financial difficulties, which is why he has only been raising livestock.  Now that his children have grown, they also need to create their own families, and Hotamqul is trying hard to gather enough money for their dowries. 

Hotamqul currently owns a few head of livestock, but he would like to buy a few more before the spring.  Livestock prices will go up in the spring and if he does not purchase livestock before then, he will not be able to resell at a profit and therefore increase his capital.

Hotamqul is hoping to receive financial support from Kiva, as this is the only way to see his project materialize.  He is very grateful that, thanks to an organization like Kiva, people who have financial difficulties are able to solve them and achieve their goals.

He plans to use his loan to buy some livestock and animal feed.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more coconuts, and her production and income improved. 

Nenita has been in the coconut sales business for 20 years now, and it helps a lot with her family expenses. She and her husband, who is a community counselor, work hard to provide income for their family. 

Nenita would like to apply for another 24,000 PHP loan to buy more coconuts for her business. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and to pay for the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. She hopes her business will continue to grow. She hopes to improve her family's standard of living.

Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a hog farmer living at Solana with her spouse and three children. They make their living farming and raising hogs for sale. They manage their businesses to provide the best education for their children. Mercedita usually gains 3,000 PHP for each hog she sells. Her income helps her to maintain her hogs and provide a daily allowance for her children. 

Mercedita is now asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to invest in her business. She will buy feed, vaccines, and medicines for hog farming. This will help her grow healthier hogs and sell them at a higher profit.

Mercedita would like to keep improving her family's businesses to sustain the education needs of her children so that they can earn degrees and improve their employment options.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and medicines for her hogs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Minakhan

texts.ru: Минахан очень благодарна всем инвесторам фонда КИВА. Предыдущий кредит помог очень хорошо. В этот раз она планирует приобрести овец для перепродажи скота. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Минахон обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец.
texts.en: Minakhan is very grateful to all the Kiva lenders. The previous loan was a very good help. This time, she plans to buy sheep for resale. With the goal of further developing her business, Minakhan appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Villamor

texts.en:
Villamor is 52 years old and married with three children. Two of his children are already working, while his youngest child is still a college student.

Villamor is engaged in hog raising and farming. He currently cultivates three hectares of corn. He has been running his hog business for 20 years and farming for 25. He is thankful because, through his determination and sacrifices, he is able to help his two children finish their studies and sustain their daily needs.

Profits from his hog raising business are used to purchase expensive supplies for his corn farming business. Villamor plans to buy two additional piglets to raise, but his capital is insufficient. Villamor is asking for a loan of 27,000 PHP. He knows that this loan will really help him meet his goals in his life and in his business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and supplies for his hog raising business.

loans.name: Abdulhakim

texts.ru: Абдулхаким житель района Хамадони. Ему 53 года. Он разведен. У него пятеро детей. Абдулхаким занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. Этим видом деятельности он занимается более семи лет. Абдулхаким берет кредит для посева картошки, моркови, кукурузы и лука. Он хочет посеять и получить богатый урожай овощей для продажи.
texts.en:
Abdulhakim is a resident of the Hamadoni region. He is 53 years old. He is divorced. He has five children. 

Abdulhakim is engaged in planting crops. He has been involved in this type of activity for seven years. Abdulhakim is taking a loan to plant potatoes, carrots, corn, and onions. He wants to plant and get a bumper crop of vegetables for sale.

loans.use: to plant potatoes, carrots, corn, and onions

loans.name: Saidkhon

texts.ru:
Саидхон пожилой мужчина  в возрасте 60 лет.   Он женат у него трое детей.   Сам  Саидхон занимается торговлей разных мешков(бумажные мешки, матерчатые мешки)  для овощей и фруктов.  Ему в этом помогает его младший сын.  А старший сын тоже занимается торговлей но он продает авто-запчасти.  У них очень дружная семья, они во всем поддерживают друг друга.  Саидхон очень долгое время мечтал купить автомобиль, и сейчас они накопили немного денег но все равно не хватает на авто. Поэтому Саидхон обратился в организацию Арванд за финансовой поддержкой,чтобы получить нужную сумму и добавив свои накопленные деньги планирует купить автомашину. 
Саидхон заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Saidkhon is an older man at the age of 60 years. He is married and has three children. Saidkhon is engaged in trade of different bags (paper bags, cloth bags) for vegetables and fruits. He is helped in this by his younger son. And his older son is also engaged in trade, but he sells auto parts. They have a very close-knit family, and they all support each other. 

Saidkhon has for a very long time dreamed of buying a car, and now they have accumulated a little money but still not enough for a car. Therefore, Saidkhon appealed to Arvand for financial support, in order to get the needed amount and, adding his accumulated money, plans to purchase a car. 
 
Saidkhon sends his thanks in advance to Arvand for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Jagna, Bohol. Evelyn runs a sari-sari, or variety store, business selling various goods and items to people in her neighborhood. She has been in this business for more than 15 years now. 

Evelyn is asking for a loan to buy additional groceries to sell like rice, candies, soda, noodles, and canned goods, as well as soap and toiletries. This will help her attract more customers and cater to their needs, thus increasing her sales and profit.

In the future, Evelyn hopes to make her business a success and save money for the schooling of her children. Evelyn also wants to repay her loan on time so that she can take another one for the improvement of her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries and other items for sale at her general store.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
This is Eric. His previous loan was a big help in his business. He was able to buy new spare parts for his three-wheeled motorcycle. 

Eric has been in the motorcycle transport business for twelve years now. This business provides the income for his family, and it has helped them a lot financially. 

Eric would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts, maintain his motorcycle, and buy some equipment for his repair shop. His profits will help him to sustain his family's daily needs and pay the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Eric dreams of giving his children a good quality education and hopes for good health for his family. Every week, he faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима жительница района Пяндж. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем, имеет троих детей. Муж и двое сыновей Фотимы уехали на заработки в Россию. Фотима хочет начать свой бизнес. Ее интересует животноводческая деятельность. Так как у Фотимы нет достаточных денежных средств, она обратилась за кредитом. Она берет кредит на сумму 2000 долларов и заняться купле продажей крупно-рогатого скота. Фотима надеется на успешность своего бизнеса, и за счет прибыли женить сына.
texts.en:
Fotima is a resident of the Payandj region. She is 47 years old. She is married, and has three children. Her husband and two sons have gone to work in Russia. Fotima wants to start her own business. She is interested in livestock activities. 

Since Fotima does not have sufficient money, she applied for a loan. She is taking a loan of $2,000 and is getting involved in the buying and selling of livestock. Fotima hopes for the success of her business, and will use the profits for her son's marriage.

loans.use: to buy short-horned livestock

loans.name: Shul'amoh

texts.ru:
Шулъамох проживает в районе Кумсангир. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Муж Шулъамох находится на заработках за рубежом. Шулъамох имеет среднее образование.
Шулъамох на протяжении семи лет занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. У нее при доме имеется участок земли, где она выращивает овощи. Шулъамох берет кредит для закупа семян картошки, кукурузы и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Shul'amoh lives in the Qumsangir region. She is 39 years old, married, and has two children. Shul'amoh's husband is working abroad. Shul'amoh has a high school education.

For seven years, Shul'amoh has been planting crops. She has a plot of land near her home where she grows vegetables. 

Shul'amoh is taking a loan for the purcahse of seed potatoes, maize, and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to plant vegetables and legumes

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
This is Myrna. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the needed products for her business, which results in a bigger income. They also have a junk shop, which is managed by her husband. They are both working hard to provide income for their business.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Myrna dreams that her business will expand even more and hopes to have a vacation. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 55 years old and has a child. She is raising hogs to acquire an income. She had been in her business for over 10 years now. She usually gains PHP 2,000 for each hog sold. Now, she hopes to keep making her sales profitable and she is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to invest in her business. She will buy feed and vaccines for her hogs. This will help maintain good nutrition for the hogs and she can sell them at a profit upon maturity. 

Though she only generates a minimal income from her business, Erlinda continuously works toward better sales to achieve financial stability someday.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Cyril

texts.en:
This is Cyril. Her previous loan was a big help not just in her business but also in her everyday expenses. She has been in this business for 10 years now and her business is continuously growing. She has a stall in the market, which is a good spot for getting more customers.

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Cyril hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams of having a good and happy family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week.  There, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Alinia

texts.en: Alinia, 44 years old, is widowed and has four children. She has owned and operated a retail store in her village for almost four years. She has a net income of PHP 3,000 every month. She wants to taker a loan of PHP 17,000 to purchase canned goods, breads, curls, noodles, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can expand her retail store to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, breads, curls, noodles, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 28 years old. She owns a boutique and has been in that business for the past six years. She wants the loan to buy more chewing gums and kitchen utensils to increase her inventory in order for sale. The profits from the business will be used for making savings.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for sale such as chewing gums, kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Mame's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le 01/12/2008 il regroupe des femmes d'un même village unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.Le responsable madame Mame est une femme mariée âgée de 39 ans et mère de cinq enfants dont 2 garçons et 3 filles. 
Elle est la femme qui lève la main sur la photo, elle est habillé en wax vert fleurette.
Son nouveau crédit de 250000 francs cfa lui permettra de payer de la marchandises composée de piment poivre sel bouillon cube du lait du café et du sucre qu'elle va revendre au détail au niveau du village.
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent d'aider son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins familiers telles que payer du riz et de l'huile.
texts.en:
This group, created on December 1, 2008, consists of women who come from the same village and who are united by good social and professional relationships.

Mame is the group's representative: she is 39 years old, married, and the mother of five children (two boys and three girls).  In the photo, she is the woman raising her hand and wearing a flowery green wax-print dress.

With her new loan of 250,000 CFA francs, she will buy the following products: pimento, pepper, salt, "bouillon cubes", milk, coffee and sugar.  She will resell her goods for retail, in her village.

The profits from this loan will allow her to help her husband cover some of the family daily needs, such as the purchase of rice and oil.

loans.use: to buy condiments, milk and coffee for her small retail business.

loans.name: Ami's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe existe depuis longtemps et il regroupe deux femmes de la même localité unies par de bonnes relations sociales. Madame Amy est l'emprunteur en vedette, elle est  debout à gauche de la photo recouvert d'un écharpe blanc. 
Âgée de 57 ans, elle est mère de 10 enfants dont 5 garçons. Elle s'active dans l'embauche bovine depuis un peu longtemps et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

Son nouveau crédit de 300000 francs cfa lui permettra des moutons qu'elle va élever et revendre plus tard.
Les bénéfices réalisés par son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires de ses enfants et d'aider son mari dans l'achat de fournitures scolaires.
texts.en:
This group has been in existence for a long time.  It consists of two women who are from the same locality and are united by good social relationships.  Ami, the featured borrower, is the woman on the left in the photo, wearing a white scarf.  She is 57 years old and the mother of ten children, five of whom are boys.  For a while now, she has been actively involved in fattening livestock, and she has a good experience in this field.

With her new loan of 300,000 CFA francs, she will buy some sheep and raise them for future resale.

Thanks to the profits from her business, she will be able to cover her children's nutritional needs and will also help her husband with the purchase of school supplies.

loans.use: to buy two sheep for fattening up.

loans.name: Merilen

texts.en:
Merilen is a 41-year-old married woman from Jagna, Bohol, Philippines. She is a mother of a 16-year-old son. Merilen operates a convenience store, selling various goods to the people in her place. She has been in the business for more than five years now.

Merilen is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, candies, rice, beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, candies, rice, beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa owns and runs a home-based variety store. She is 44 years of age and married with two children. Elsa's dream is to have a stable source of income and be able to sell school supplies within her locality. Elsa is a business-oriented woman; she currently manages a variety store and a fish pond, and does farming and hog raising.

Elsa aims to make all her businesses profitable so she could let her two children finish their studies, sustain their basic needs, increase the hectares of rice field she cultivates and increase the number of hogs she raises. To make all these things possible, Elsa is requesting additional capital in the amount of 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos). She will be using this capital in buying a variety of groceries such as instant noodles, soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, ingredients and various kinds of vegetables. She knows that through the completeness of groceries she offers, she can further increase her sales and profits, which will lead her to obtain better income.

loans.use: to buy a variety groceries such as instant noodles, soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, ingredients and various kinds of vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials for constructing a zero-grazing unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for stocks of coffee and herbal products needed in her business.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 61 years old, married with five children, and living in Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. Isabel sells dried fish for a living. She has been doing this for ten years. She has requested a loan to purchase more dried fish to sell.
Isabel has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
This is Edwin. His previous loan was a big help in his business. He was able to buy the necessary ingredients for his food stall. The loan also helped in meeting the everyday expenses that he and his wife work hard to meet. He has been in this business for ten years. He also does landscaping projects.

He would like to apply for another loan of 14,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients such as rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in his business. The profits from the business will definitely help him to sustain his family's daily needs and his children's educational expenses. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Edwin dreams that his youngest child will finish his studies and hopes that his business will grow even more. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients such as rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married with four children. Jocelyn is 50 years old and lives in P.3 , Labo Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Jocelyn sells dried fish to earn a living. Each week, she earns 700 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 7000 PHP to purchase more dried fish for her retail business.

Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for five years.  In the future, Jocelyn hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Robelyn

texts.en:
Robelyn is 34 years old and lives in Brgy. Tabid, Ozamiz city, Philippines. She is married with two school-aged children and one infant.

Robelyn will use the loan amount to repair their house. She is also engaged in food production and sales fully supported by her husband. She's been doing this for almost two years.

Robelyn has been a member of PMPC for almost six years. She hopes to operate a small business in the city after two years.

loans.use: To purchase some materials needed  for house repair.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is 45 years old and is married to Romeo, a father who works as a farmer. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with three children. To generate income, Rowena has been engaged in her general store for nine years and usually earns about 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a day. At this time, Rowena is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 PHP to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, delicacies, and condiments to sell. Rowena hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, delicacies, and condiments to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
This is Anita. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the needed materials for her tailoring business, and she was able to make more dresses. She has been in this business for three years now, and it continues to grow. She is working hard to provide income for her everyday expenses. 

She would like to apply for another 14,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) loan for her to buy fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Anita dreams to have a good and prosperous life and hopes that her business will grow even more. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their lives and businesses every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie didn't finish her studies due to lack of finances. She is now 28 years of age and happily married with four children. All her four children go to school. Lanie doesn't want her children to experience what she went through during her young age. So, at her best, she endures everything in order to give her family a better way of living.

Lanie offers chicken joy (a fried chicken dish) and intestine of chicken, using flour. People sometimes refer to it as "tokong." She sell her products within the high school of her local community. Through her dedication and help of her husband, she is able to increase her sales. Lanie plans to buy stock flour, sticks, cooking oil, and additional kilograms of chicken legs for her food sales business. With regards to her goal, she is seeking financial assistance amounting to 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP). She hopes and prays that this loan amount will be granted for her to have continuous growth of business and to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to use in buying flour, oil, and chicken for her food production and sale business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 57 years old and lives in Bliss, Culo, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with two children.

She has a general store that sells different goods. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan to purchase more stock for her general store such as soap, toothpaste, sugar, etc.

Edna has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as soap, toothpaste, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Christ Vivant Group

texts.en:
Richard, age 46, is married with 3 children, ages 9 to 19 years old. All 3 of his children are currently in school. He is representing the Christ Vivant group. Richard owns a butcher shop and has had this business for 5 years. He will use the loan to buy more meat for his shop, including chicken, tripe, pork, and turkey. His business strategy is to put the meat in different sized groups. The larger groups with more meat are cheaper per gram than the smaller groups of meat. He is able to sell more meat this way. 
Richard has received 3 previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He wants to have a large butcher shop one day with a big sign advertising his business. He hopes his children will finish university and be able to travel abroad one day.

loans.use: to pay for chicken, tripe, pork, and turkey for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is married with two children. Rolando is 51 years old and lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur.

To earn a living, Rosalindo has a vulcanizing shop for motorcycles. He has had this business for 15 years. Each month, he earns approximately PHP 5000. He requested a loan to purchase equipment for his vulcanizing shop. Rolando has been a member of PMPC for four years.

In the future, Rolando hopes to buy more equipment for his business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for his vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin, tiene la edad  de 67 años, está casado y vive  con la esposa y dos hijos. El con el dinero va comprar unas vacas para la producción de leche. La cuenta con el terreno apto para mantener estos animales y para poder alimentarlas de buena forma, además el cuenta con la experiencia de varios años en el cuido de ganado. El quiere obtener de estos animales un muy buen rendimiento en la producción de leche. El tiene como meta generar la leche suficiente para  poder venderla al mercado de la localidad generando así ingresos para su bienestar  y la de la familia y  mejorar su calidad de vida día con día. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Edwin, 67, is married and lives with his wife and two children.  He plans to use the loan to buy dairy cattle.  He owns land that is ideal for raising and feeding the cattle, and also has several years' experience caring for livestock.  His goal is to produce enough milk to sell to the local market and generate an income for the family's well-being while improving their quality of life on a daily basis.  This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has never had a state bank loan; FUDECOSUR is giving him better loan terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a farmer aged 40 in Litein County in Kenya where she lives with her husband and four children, who are all schooling. She has been in farming for the past thirteen years producing sugar cane, milk, and potatoes, which she sells at the local market in her area.

She is requesting a 50,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase materials for constructing a zero grazing unit, which will help her take better care of her dairy cows. It is hoped that it will produce more milk and earn her extra income, which will help her boost her family's living standards. Regina will also be able to use some of the money to pay school fees for her children.

Poor weather conditions, pests and diseases are her major challenges in farming.

Regina is very thankful to Juhudi Kilimo for assisting her in getting the loan.

loans.use: to purchase materials for constructing a dairy unit.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, tiene la edad 39 de años, está casado y vive con sus tres  hijos y su esposa. El pretende con el crédito comprar herramientas para su taller mecánico. El cuenta con un local y la experiencia necesaria para seguir adelante con el proyecto, por lo cual él quiere comprar más herramienta para así darles a sus clientes una mejor atención. El con la compra de esta herramienta perfeccionara sus trabajos y podrá ofrecerle a sus clientes mejores resultados con mayor calidad. El quiere con esto generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para el bienestar de su familia y propio. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Juan, 39, is married and lives with his wife and three children.  He wants to use the loan to buy tools for his vehicle repair shop.  He has a shop location and the necessary experience to carry out his project, so he wants to buy more tools to be able to give his customers better service.  The tools will allow him to do a better job so he can offer his customers better quailty.  His aim is to generate more income for his family's well-being.  This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has never had a state bank loan before; FUDECOSUR is giving him better loan terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy tools.

loans.name: Sorpresa Group

texts.es:
El Grupo "Sorpresa" esta integrado por cinco mujeres muy trabajadoras y un hombre que hacen lo posible para que sus familias tengan una mejor calidad de vida, los integrantes son Doña Adelina, Juana, Leticia, Juliana, Noé y Benita. Todos los integrantes han solicitado el crédito para invertirlo en borregos solo Doña Leticia invertirag en bordados. El nombre del grupo lo eligió La señora Lety, como le llaman de cariño, quien también forma parte del grupo platica que decidió ponerle este nombre al grupo ya que el día que la invitaron para invitarla al crédito le llamo mucho la atención y para Doña Lety era una muy buena opción es por eso que fue de “Sorpresa” que llegaran a su casa a invitarla para invitarla crédito. Doña Benita tiene 46 años de edad esta casada con el señor Pablo quien trabaja de albañil ellos ya tiene varios años viviendo juntos a lo largo del tiempo formaron una familia con 6 hijos de los cuales solo 3 hijos dependen de dicha pareja y que aun asisten a la escuela.
Doña Benita se dedica a la crianza de borregos los compra desde que son unos coorderitos para criarlos por tres o cuatro meses para que cuando ya estén grandes y gordos los puedan ofrecer pero si algun cliente quiere algun coorderito recien nacido lo vendo tambien, Doña Benita tiene ya 20 años criando sus borregos "Inicie la crianza de mis borregos porque yo estaba en otra microfinanciera y el credito que me daban en esa microfinaciera compraba mis borregos desde que inicie con mis borregos nunca he tenido ningun problema solo si se llegan a enfermar pero nada grave" Doña Benita es una mujer muy trabajadora con mucho entusiamo cuanta que su mayor ilusion sera ver a sus hijas con una profesion que les pueda ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. Los integrantes del grupo estan muy agradecidos con Vision Fund y KIVA por el credito otorgado porque para ellos es una manera mejorar su actividad productiva.
texts.en:
The Sorpresa group is made up of 5 hard-working women and one man, who do whatever is possible to provide their families with a better quality of life. The group members are Adelina, Juana, Leticia, Juliana, Benita and Noé; all of the members are applying for this loan to invest it in buying lambs.  Only Leticia (Lety) will use it for her embroidery business. The group name was chosen by Lety, who says that they decided to use this name because the day that the institution called at the house to invite them to apply for their loan, she was very surprised by it and she thought that this was a good choice for a name. 

Another member, Benita, is 46 and married to Pablo who is a bricklayer.  They have lived together for quite some time and have a family of six children, three of whom still live at home and go to school.

Benita raises sheep which she buys when they are young, and fattens them for three or four months to sell.  Sometimes a customer wants a baby lamb, which she also sells.  She has been in business for 20 years, "I began raising sheep through another micro-lending instititution and never ran into any problems, except for sheep illness, but nothing serious."  Benita is an enthusiastic worker whose greatest goal is to see her daughters finish their careers so they can have a better quality of life.  The members of the group are very grateful to Vision Fund and KIVA for the loan since it will allow them to improve their business activities.

loans.use: Comprara 2 borregos y pastura para los mismos borregos.

loans.name: Familia Castulo Group

texts.es: El grupo "Familia Castulo" es la segunda vez que esta solicitando el credito a la institucion ellos solo son tres integrantes son familiares y son perosonas muy serias (responsables) en cuanto al trabajo que realizan les gusta mucho trabajar para mejorar su vida. Doña Esther es integrante del grupo platica que tiene 38 años de casada con el señor Rogelio juntos han formado una familia con tres hijos de los cuales se encuentran estudiando, Doña Esther y Don Rogelio tienen un pequeña taller de costura donde elaboran cualquier tipo de prenda como abrigos, pants, chalecos etc. paltican que su taller de costura desde hace 10 años al parecer esa actividad viene de la familia de la señora Esther pero cuando se casaron decidieron independizarse y llevar a cabo ellos solos la actividad, platican que la ropa que elaboran la van a vender a la cuidad de Mexico ya que alla se vende mejor conocen muy bien la zona porque desde ellos eran originarios de ahi, solo que su unica difucultad es cuando no se vende muy bien o cuando alguna de sus maquinas se encuentra fallanado y les impide realizar su trabajo con calidad, Doña Esther y Don Rogelio comentaron "Nuestra meta es que algun dia nuestras prendas sean pedidas por mayoreo y ya solo sean pedidos grandes donde solo vayamos a entregar y no como estamos vendiendo tenemos que ir a la ciudad para ofrecerlos y a ver si nos comprar, ya que si llegamos a tener compradores seguros podemos darles una mejor calidad de vida a nuestros hijos y darle mantenimiento a nuestra casa" Doña Micaela tambien forma parte del grupo ella esta solicitando el credito para comprar dulces y zapatos de segunda mano para su venta. Los integranres del grupo estan muy contentos y agradecidos con VisionFund y KIVA por el credito otorgado.
texts.en:
The group "Familia Castulo" is requesting its second loan through the institution.  All three members are family and very responsible people who enjoy the work they do to lead a better lifestyle.  Esther is one of the members of the group and she is 38 and married to Rogelio.  They have three school-aged children.  Esther and Rogelio have a small sewing shop where they make all kinds of clothing, such as coats, pants, jackets, etc.  They have been in business for ten years and, apparently, the business comes from Esther's side of the family.  But when they married they decided to open their own business.  They take the clothing they produce to Mexico City where they sell it at a good price.  They know the area very well because that is where they are from originally.  The only problem they run into is when something does not sell well or when one of their sewing machines breaks down and affects the quality of their work.

Esther and Rogelio say:  "Our goal is to be able to sell our clothing wholesale one day on a large order basis, and not like we do now having to go to the city to make a sale.  If we are able to have a fixed customer base we can give our children a better lifestyle and renovate our house."  Another member, Micaela, will use the loan to buy sweets and second-hand shoes to sell.  The members are very happy and grateful to VisionFund and KIVA for this loan.

loans.use: To buy fabric, buttons, closures, etc.

loans.name: Nishat's Group

texts.en:
Nishat has been running a general store for the past three years. Nishat is a very hard-working woman, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a watchman.

Nishat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase some goods like soaps, shampoos, sugar, rice, etc. for the store. She dreams of living in her own house as presently she is living in a rented house. With the profit she will put aside some savings for her children's future.

Note: In the picture Nishat holding a passbook.

loans.use: To purchase some goods like soaps, shampoos, sugar and  rice to sell.

loans.name: Mary Group

texts.en:
Mary group, which was formed in 2008, has ten hard-working women as members. These women belong to one of the tribal groups known as Thadou Kuki and they all settled  in New Keithelmanbi village, Sadar Hills, Manipur state,which is in the North Eastern part of India. They have empowered themselves in survival and sustainability through the formation of the group.

Tinkhoneng, the profiled member, is standing with a hand raised. She is 42 and a mother to six sons and a daughter. All her children are being sent to school which is a big burden for the family. Her husband rears some pigs and generates some income. Being hard workers, both she and her husband would take up any work to keep the family going.

In 2009, she received the first loan with which she bought flowers grown in the wild in bulk and rare flower seeds and sold them. In doing so, she could earn some profit. In the following year, along with her husband she reared pigs with the second loan. That too was successful. Leaving her husband with the piggery farming, with the third loan she wants to buy varieties of flowers. This time she wants to include all stages, from nursery bed flowers to full grown ones. 

The other members of the group are engaged in piggery and poultry farming, charcoal, weaving and vegetable businesses.  Each and every member has somehow found a means of living and sustaining themselves and their families, and above all, they have set a good example to non-members in the village.

loans.use: To purchase and sell varieties of flowers

loans.name: Naomi Group

texts.en:
Naomi Group was formed in 2010 and is comprised of 5 women members. All the members live in the same village by the name of Nungsai Chiru Village in the Senapati district of Manipur which is in the North Eastern part of India. The one and only reason why the group was formed is ‘coming together to help one another and supplementing family incomes by accessing loans’.

Jahonghoi is the profiled member pictured with raised hand. She is 42 and has a son and a daughter, who are both being sent to a private boarding school for a better education. The school is located some 40 kms from her native village. Her husband, who is a peon by profession, works at the village water supply office. His monthly wage (salary) is just enough to manage their children’s boarding school costs. In order to supplement the family income, Jahonghoi has taken up the business of buying and selling firewood. She buys firewood wholesale from one place and sells it retail to different places. Though the business can be expanded, she has to stick to her capacity because she cannot afford it financially. With some profit she earns, she is helping her husband in keeping the family going. This was how she tried to earn income before she accessed loans.

With some part of her first loan in 2011, she was able to expand her firewood business to some extent. With the remaining part of the loan, she managed to add some more activities to her business like selling vegetables and bananas as she found favorable with time and place. Adding more activities was also quite helpful as they could be done on a daily basis. She still wants to expand her business based on a daily, weekly and monthly basis because she finds that her income flow was better and it also helps her in repaying her loan. In order to keep her business running, she has requested another loan.

The other group members are engaged with growing and selling spring onions. They have successfully utilized the first loan and have earned benefits financially which help them in generating income to support themselves and their respective families. To continue with their business, they are awaiting another loan.

loans.use: To buy a lot of firewood and sell it for a  profit.

loans.name: Warrah

texts.en:
Warrah is 35 years old and married. She has 3 children, ages 5, 10 and 19. She runs a store in Waterloo branch, Western Area Region in Sierra Leone.

Warrah has been in this business for 10 years and sells soft drinks, pure water, sugar and variety of goods at her store. Her business is the only income she has. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation and completion in the market.

Warrah requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy different varieties of goods like soft drinks, pure water and sugar. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to increase her business and take good care of her children. In the future, she would like to build a permanent business location. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy different varieties of goods like soft drinks, pure water and sugar.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma, 35 years old is married with four children all of whom are still in school. She lives in the town of Tiribe, Kenya. She is the owner of a store in her private house, which sells firewood and charcoal at retail price. She is a hardworking person whose goal is to be able to continue growing her business and to be able to continue helping her family and to take care of the day to day expenses.

She is requesting this loan for KSH.50,000 to be able to restock her business and buy both the charcoal and firewood in a large quantity so she will get them at a cheaper price so as to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: to restock her business and buy both the charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is taking a loan for the second time, having taken the first and successfully repaid it without much difficulty. She wants to expand her business. That is why she has approached Yehu for a loan amounting to KES 50,000 to buy more food ingredients to use in the business.

loans.use: to buy more wheat flour, cooking oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Domitilia

texts.en:
Domitilia is from Tirebe, Mombasa. She’s a very hardworking person who has always worked and striven to reach her goals and objectives. She owns a grocery store in town in which she has stocked with fruits and vegetables. She has had it for more than three years and comments that it’s attained good renown in the neighborhood and thanks to that she has good customer-seller relationships. She defines herself as a person who always strives to the maximum to attain what she wants.

She is asking for a loan amounting to KES 40,000 to buy tomatoes, onions, potatoes and watermelon to stock her stall. She is grateful for this opportunity that will help her very much.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, potatoes and watermelon to stock her stall.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en: Mwanasiti is approaching Yehu for a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings for the second time. This is after successfully repaying her previous loan without much difficulty. She is very grateful for the assistance given; however, she needs to expand her business now and buy passion fruits. That is why she has approached Yehu for a loan.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit for resale.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is 46 years old, married and has two children. She lives in Msambweni, Kenya. She owns a charcoal stall where she sells charcoal and firewood. Her major customers are schools near her stall where she has won the tender to supply them with both firewood and charcoal.

She recently won another tender to supply firewood to two more secondary schools therefore she needs to expand her bushiness and increase the amount of charcoal and firewood she has in store. Saumu has requested a loan of 50000 KES so that she will be able to supply the two customers effectively.

loans.use: to expand her bushiness by  increasing the amount of charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is approaching Yehu with a loan request for 50,000 Kenyan shillings as a subsequent loan after successfully repaying her previous loan which she repaid with little difficulty. She has proved to be a hardworking and enthusiastic borrower who is ready and willing to sacrifice all she can to achieve her dreams.

Saumu wants to use this loan to pay school fees for her children who recently started high school. She is grateful for the chance, as it has helped her improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children who recently started high school.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo is 27 years old. She lives in a home she owns with a niece. She is  married with two children aged 5 and 8 years old. She has always worked and been responsible and enterprising. She has a small business selling Khangas door to door. In addition to this business, she also sells coconuts from her home. She does this after she goes to sell her khangas, during her free time. She is described as friendly and that's why her customers prefer her. She wants to buy bundles of khangas for sell; and also more coconuts to sell and that is why she has asked Yehu for a loan to achieve this.

loans.use: to buy bundles of khangas for sell; and also more coconuts

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas lives in the Kongowea area of Central Province, Kenya. He is a married father of four school-going children. He started the farming business through his own savings. 

Thomas learnt about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group. He joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. The main challenge he faces is seasonal weather.

Thomas is applying for a loan of  21,050 Kenya shillings to buy seedlings and fertilizers. He will use the extra income from the loan to educate his children. His future plan in five years is to do large scale farming.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mgombolwa Group

texts.en:
Khadija, who is in her early 40s, is married with four children who are still going to school. She has a business of selling baby's disposable napkins (diapers) up-country.  She has been in this business for three years now. She is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to pay school fees, cover household expenses and purchase a washing machine and radio. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She will use this loan to buy more disposable napkins to resell up-country. She dreams of buying a daladala (a minibus).

She will share this loan with her loan group "MGOMBOLWA," which has 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more diapers to resell up-country.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a 40-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 6 years to 16 years old. She describes herself to be polite and a warm woman. She operates a butcher shop  where she sells meat. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Mildred will use the Kes 8,700 loan to buy a water tank which will be used by her family members on household activities. Her business goal is to run a slaughterhouse within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM after managing to repay a loan of Kes 30,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 43 years old and is from Tiribe, Kenya. She has a fruits and vegetables stall business. She sells from her stall near her home.
Beatrice is a dedicated woman with the urge to move forward. Her dream is to continue working and help her family move ahead. Her merchandise has gone down, so she is asking for a loan of 40,000 KES to expand her business and buy fruits and vegetables to continue working and offering good products to her customers. By doing so, she is sure she will provide better life to her family.

loans.use: to expand her business and buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Ma. Gracia

texts.en:
This is Gracia. She previously accessed an 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gracia hopes that her business will grow even more and dreams to provide her children with a good education and a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Famil

texts.en:
Famil is a young businessman with big hopes for the future. He is a 26-year-old farmer, living with his wife and two little children. 

Famil has 10 years experience in farming, producing milk & milk products which he sells at the local market.

He is requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow which will help in getting more milk produce and help to earn extra income, from selling the milk. This will help him uplift his living standards and pay for his family needs without his parent's support.

loans.use: To buy one dairy cow.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a fish vendor from Bohol, Philippines. She is a 46 year old married woman and has three children. Anecita has been in the business for more than 20 years now. Her husband is a fisherman.

Anecita is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Anecita hopes to make her business a success and sustainable. 

Moreover, she wants to save money to buy a new fishing boat for her husband.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, she previously accessed an 13,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more stocks of mineral water needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stocks of mineral water needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Susan hopes that her business will grow and expand. She dreams of having a happy and good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their business and life every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stocks of mineral water to expand her product.

loans.name: Emelynda

texts.en:
Emelynda is 51 years old and has three children. Emelynda is married and has one child who is in school.

Emelynda is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Emelynda requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Emelynda has been in the business for 8 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emelynda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Kamila

texts.en:
Kamila is 47 years old and a widow. She raises her one daughter alone. She sells seasonal fruits such as pears, oranges, apples, pomegranates and bananas. With the help of AqroInvest CU Kamila was able to start her own business. She has 10 years of experience and the reason to start her business was no options to find a permanent job.  

Fruits are very popular among Azerbaijan people and in high demand during year.  People like to eat it fresh and this is one of the main desserts for guests. She sells crops from her house and people always pass by and buy some fresh fruits. Her monthly income from this business is 250 AZN. Kamila's daughter helps her to sell fruits.

Kamila wants to expand her business. The amount of products she sells is not enough to cover high demand. She would like to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase her turnover as well as to improve life of her family. For this purpose she applied for 1000 AZN loan. This will be her second loan and Kamila has good client history.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables  to increase sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials for constructing a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy  200 bricks for his building business.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is engaged in the hog raising business. She lives with her husband and seven children in Bohol, Philippines. Anecita has been in the business for more than three years now. Her husband works as a carpenter. Anecita is asking for a loan to buy feeds and supplements for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her hog raising business thus increasing her profit and income. Moreover, she wants to save money so that she can continually support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy feeds and supplements for the pigs

loans.name: Noreen's Group

texts.en:
Noreen is 49 years old and a very hardworking woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her family. Her family consist of three children and her husband. They are going through a very difficult time and facing many financial issues. From the past 3 years Noreen has been running a dairy business and having 5 buffaloes. She wants to purchase one more buffalo so that she can increase her family's net income and can easily cope with the increase demand of customers. 

For that Noreen as a member of a four-person lending group has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase one buffalo for her dairy business. This will help her to increase her dairy product sales and net income.
 
Her personal goals are to provide education and a better future to her children. She is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a buffalo for her small dairy business.

loans.name: Noreen's Group

texts.en:
Noreen is a 46-year-old hardworking house wife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, two sons, and two daughters. She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. Her husband has been running a grocery store in the market in which he is selling rice, pulses, beans, and flour. This store is the only source of income for the family. Currently the stock of rice of his store is finished therefore he wants to purchase rice packs for his store. But due to the financial constrain he finds it difficult. 

For that his wife Noreen, as member of a 4-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase rice packs for her husband's grocery store. This will help her husband to satisfy the demands of customers and to increase his savings as well.

Noreen is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them. She is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy rice , beans and flour to resell

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra is a 54-year-old hardworking woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, two sons, and three daughters. One of her sons owns a small curtain shop and the other one is a motor mechanic. Two of her daughters are married and the youngest one is a student. 

Since 2002 Azra has been running her own clothing business in her house. She purchase clothes from different areas and sells them in her community and in the market. She needs additional capital to increase her business. She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase clothing for her small business. This will help her to increase her savings and net income. She is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for her small clothing business.

loans.name: Oktay

texts.en:
Oktay is a 43-year-old man. He is married with one son. He breeds cattle and sells them to local butchers. Oktay has 9 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him how to look after cattle.

Oktay usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them in 5-6 months and resells them for a more profitable price at the local livestock bazaar. Meat selling brings an income of 350 AZN per month. People use beef in everyday national dishes such as Pilau and Dolma. 

This is only income for his family and is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Oktay applied for 1500 AZN to purchase four cattle. This will be his third loan with AqroInvest and he has good client history.

loans.use: to buy four cattle.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is a very active member of Yehu Microfinance.  She is a very hardworking woman. This is a subsequent loan after successful repayment of the previous without any difficulties. She is grateful as it has helped her to pay school fees for her children as well as improve her family’s living standards. She wants to venture into a new business of motorbike operation and that is why she has requested a loan for KSH.100000 to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Mathy

texts.en:
This is Mathy. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more and a greater variety of processed food products to expand her inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 16,000 PHP loan to buy more stocks of frozen and processed food for her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mathy hopes to buy a stall for her business and dreams to give her children a good education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week. At these meetings, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay back microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of frozen and processed food needed in her business.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy is a 25-year-old farmer in Litein County in Kenya where he lives with his wife and one child who has not started school.  He has been in farming for the past eight years producing tea and milk which he sells at the local market in his area. He owns a motor bike and runs a transportation business as an additional source of income.

He is requesting a 65,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase materials for constructing a zero grazing unit which will help him in taking good care of his dairy cows which will produce more milk and he will earn extra income to uplift his livelihood and will later use some of the money to pay for his child's schooling.

Poor markets for his crops are his major challenge in farming.
Willy is thankful to Juhudi Kilimo for the grace period it gives to their clients.

loans.use: to purchase materials for constructing a dairy unit.

loans.name: Adulia

texts.en:
Adulia is 37 years old and married with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Adulia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

Adulia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Antiqa

texts.en:
Antiqa is a 58-year-old woman, married with four children.  She sells food products such as macaroni, butter, cookies, sugar, tea, candies and beverages in her shop. Antiqa has about 10 years of experience in this field and she is considered as a knowledgeable and skilled person.

The food products she sells are very popular among people and in high demand. Her monthly profit from selling foods is 400 AZN and it increased after obtaining a loan from AqroInvest.  She is a very successful entrepreneur because of a good location in the central bazaar of her home city.  

The profit she gains is not enough to reinvest into the business and being able to cover customers' demand is suffering for this reason. Being the main source of income, her profit is used for family needs. Antiqa would like to increase her sales and invest additional capital. For this purpose, she applied for 1,600 AZN. She will purchase and diversify with additional foodstuffs. She is a very responsible person.  AqroInvest has cooperated with Antiqa for the last two years and she has finished previous loans without any delays.

loans.use: to buy more food products to satisfy customers' demands

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma is a married woman and a mother of two children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business, together with her husband, for more than ten years now.

Anselma is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, hooks and lead weights. With this, her husband will be able to improve his daily catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Anselma hopes of expanding their business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, hooks and lead weights

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Arlene requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials for fishing. She has been in this business for 18 years now.

In the future, Arlene would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 29 year old married man and supports three people. Thomas runs a small scale farming business as well as a retail shop. He has been in business for the last two years and his monthly income from both businesses is 10,000 KES.

He has borrowed his fourth loan of 20,000 KES which he intends to use to purchase farm inputs e.g. fertilizer, insecticides and seedlings and also add stock of crates of bread and soft drinks for sale in his retail shop.

He plans to plough the additional income back into the business and save some to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs e.g. fertilizer, insecticides and seedlings and also add stock of crates of bread and soft drinks

loans.name: M'ituru

texts.en: M'Ituru, a businessman living in Nanyuki,  is glad about being in Milango. After his introduction to Milango, he purchased tea tree seedlings from the first loan he received. M'Ituru would like to expand the farm and is applying for an additional loan of 10,734 Kenya shillings to purchase more tea tree seedlings.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 31 years old.  He is married, has one son and supports two people in the family.

He operates agro-vet shop whereby he sells variety of animal medicine, seeds for planting, animals feeds e.t.c His customers are mostly farmers, livestock traders.He has been in this business for the last five years and consistently earns a monthly income of 50,000 KES.  He is taking his third loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more stock of animal medicines, assorted seeds and animal feeds.  He plans to reinvest the anticipated profit in the business.

He hopes to grow the business in order to earn more profit that will help him support his family. He also has a dream of supplying enough stock to the community to become the leading supplier.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of animal medicines, assorted seeds and animal feeds

loans.name: Nivaldo Enrique

texts.es: A Nibaldo  su credikiva anterior lo benefició,  porque  lo invirtió en su negocio y aumentó su capital de trabajo, mejoró la liquidez, se incrementaron  sus utilidades y el número de clientes. Como vemos desde que  recibió su credikiva muchas cosas han mejorado, y además con las utilidades matriculó a sus niñas en le colegio y realizó mejoras a su vivienda. Él dice a los financiadores lo siguiente: “Estoy muy agradecido con el apoyo económico recibido por la Fundación y por Kiva y a eso debo el haber logrado mi nivel de vida familiar.” En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará  pasabocas, refrescos, al por mayor y de contado, pues se acerca una de las temporadas de mayor volumen de ventas, por efecto de los carnavales de la ciudad y su negocio necesita estar bien surtido, para que la gente que lo disfruta,  pueda deleitarse de estas fiestas  disfrazándose, bebiendo, comiendo en el estadero de Nivaldo y bailando al ritmo de los tambores del Caribe.
texts.en:
Nivaldo put his first Kiva loan to good use, investing it in his business, increasing his working capital and improving his cash flow which led to increased profits and higher customer numbers.  As we see, many things have improved since he received his Kiva loan and, in addition, he was able to use the profits to enrol his daughters in school and carry out some improvements to his home.  He has this message for those who provided his funding: "I am very grateful for the financial support I have received from the foundation and from Kiva and it is thanks to this that I have achieved this standard of living for my family."  

He is currently applying for another Kiva loan which he will use to make bulk cash purchases of snacks and soft drinks.  This is particularly important now as the city carnival, one of the peak sales seasons, is approaching and he needs to have his shop well stocked so people can enjoy themselves and revel in the celebrations by wearing disguises, drinking, eating in Nivaldo's pub and dancing to the rhythm of Caribbean drums.

loans.use: to make bulk cash purchases of snacks and soft drinks

loans.name: Parvana

texts.en:
Parvana is a 45-year-old woman who runs a private business. She is a market vendor and her primarily activity is selling food products.
