She has been selling different kinds of goods such as yoghurt, sausages, candies, cookies and macaronis for the last 10 years. She is responsible for her two daughters and a son. 

Her business brings her a stable income of about 300 AZN. Her daughter helps to sell products from the shop. Parvana would like to increase her income and for this purpose she applied for 1,800 AZN. She will use this loan to diversify and purchase more products for her shop. This will be her fifth loan and she has had a good loan history since 2003.

loans.use: to buy more foods to cover the needs of customers.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques, les quatre femmes du groupe Benkadi ont en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Cinzana Gare chef lieu de commune rurale dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles font l’achat et la vente des condiments (Piments et Sounbala), pagnes wax et ustensiles en plastiques. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sitan (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments de toutes sortes dans le village de Cinzana Gare. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 200kg de piment et 1000 morceaux de Sounbala en gros avec les foraines des villages environnants de Ségou au marché Médine. La revente se fait au comptant, à crédit, à domicile et à la foire du village à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Sitan espère trouver un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 47.000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer les soins de santé des enfants du foyer.
texts.en:
Married and mainly living in monogamous family environments, the 4 women of the Benkadi group have an average age of 39 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in the village of Cinzana Gare, the main town of a rural commune in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of Mali), and got to know each other thanks to neighbourly and family relationships, and marriage. They buy and sell condiments (peppers and sumbala, a condiment made from néré seeds), wax cloth pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing) and plastic utensils. The members of the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their business and are on their 4th group loan cycle.

Sitan (the woman standing first on the left in the picture) is a large seller of all sorts of condiments in the village of Cinzare Gare. She plans to use her loan to buy 200 kgs of peppers and 1000 patties of sumbala wholesale, together with the stall holders from the surrounding villages, at the Médine market of Ségou. She makes her sales for cash or credit from her home and at the village market to a customer base mainly composed of women. Sitan hopes to make an average monthly profit of 47 000 francs with the help of this loan, which will be reinvested in her business and used to take care of the health care of the children in the household.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Megdulia Victoria

texts.es: Megdulia Victoria es una mujer de 69 años, tiene tres hijos de 30, 40 y 42 años de edad, todos independientes, Megdulia tiene un negocio de fritanga en su casa desde hace treinta y un años, lo inicio como una forma de subsistir y solventar los gastos dentro de su hogar, lo inicio con ahorros propios y con ayuda de su esposo, que actualmente es jubilado pensionado; su negocio se volvió muy famoso dentro de su localidad y todos conocen su fritanga como LA LULA  y de igual forma a Megdulia. El objetivo del crédito es para reforzar su capital de trabajo, a través de la compra de insumos que utiliza en su negocio como granos básicos, carnes y otros, ya que si logra comprar materia suficiente se evitaría tiempo haciendo compras muy seguido, planea mantener su negocio para en un futuro realizar remodelaciones en su casa.
texts.en:
Megdulia Victoria is a 69 year old woman who has three children aged 30, 40 and 42, all of whom are independent. Megdulia has owned a fried foods business in her house for the last 31 years. She set it up as a way of subsisting and paying her household bills. She started off with her own savings and with the help of her husband, who is now a retired pensioner. Her business has become very famous in her area and everyone knows her fried foods called LA LULA and her as Megdulia. 

The aim of this loan is to strengthen her work capital by means of buying supplies which she uses in her business such as basic grains, meat and other items. If she manages to buy and stockpile enough she will avoid having to go shopping so often. She plans to keep her business going so she can renovate her house in the future.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, coal and oil, among other items.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is 33 years old, married, and has two infant-age children. He didn't enter into higher levels of education due to the lack of funds. Even though he didn't finished his studies, he didn't lose his hopes in life; instead it pushed him toward new opportunities and challenges.

Allan said, "Fishing is just like trial and error." He says these words because he has gone through many trials and errors in his everyday fishing. Sometimes he only gets a few eels because of his strategies and due to the kind of rod he uses in fishing. Allan wants to earn more income because he feels badly when he can't give his children what they need because he can't afford it due to the unstable business he has. His situation really pushes him to work hard and adopt new strategies in proper fishing so he can increase the kilograms of eels he gets.

Now, he would like to buy a Motolite battery, a flashlight, wire, a rod and a condenser so he can avoid any trouble during his fishing time. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of PHP5,000. He hopes to get this loan so he can get ahead in life and improve his fish selling business.

loans.use: to buy a Motolite battery, a flashlight, rod, wire and condenser which will be used in getting freshwater eels for his fish vending activity.

loans.name: Horonya Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf membres du groupe Horonya sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans, 5 enfants et habitent toutes dans le village de Cinzana Gare chef lieu de commune rurale dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Elles font l’achat et la vente des condiments (tomate, boites de concentrées de tomates, oignon, …), céréales, pagnes wax, draps de lits, fruits et légumes. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Kadiatou dite Youma (femme assise à gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments de toutes sortes dans le village de Cinzana Gare. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 6 cartons de boites de  concentrées de tomates  au grand marché de Bamako en gros. La revente se fait au comptant, à crédit à domicile et à la foire du village à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Kadiatou dite Youma espère trouver un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 42.000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer les besoins du foyer en condiments.
texts.en:
The 9 members of the Horonya group are married and mostly live in monogamous families. They have an average age of 45 and, on average, 5 children and all live in the village of Cinzana Gare, the main town of a rural commune in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of Mali). They got to know each other thanks to neighbourly relationships and their revenue-generating activities. They buy and sell condiments (tomatoes, boxes of tomato concentrate, onions, etc.), cereals, wax cloth pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing), bed sheets, fruits and vegetables. The members of the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their business and are on their 5th group loan cycle.

Kadiatou, commonly called Youma, (the woman sitting on the left in the picture) is a large seller of all sorts of condiments in the village of Cinzare Gare. She plans to use her loan to buy 6 boxes of tomato concentrate, wholesale, at the Bamako Grand Market. She makes her sales for cash or credit from her home and at the village market to a customer base composed mainly of women. Youma hopes to make an average monthly profit of 42 000 francs with the help of this loan, which will be reinvested in her business and used to take care of the household's condiment needs.

loans.use: to buy boxes of tomato concentrate.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials for constructing a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en:
Elnur is 33 years old. A young and very enthusiastic man, he is married with two children. He has six years of experience in selling spare car parts for Russian and foreign cars. With the help of the first loan from AqroInvest and the help of his father, he was able to start his business. Now, his father helps him and his monthly income is 400 AZN. 

Elnur used to sell spare parts of Russian cars, which was very popular; however, currently the most popular model in the region in which he lives is Mercedes. Elnur applied for a loan of 1200 AZN to purchase spare parts in demand to cover the needs of his customers. This will be his second loan and he has good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for cars which are in high demand.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
This is Rosana. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used buy more quantities of meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan to buy raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and products needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosana dreams of having a good life and hopes that her business will continue to grow. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Archil

texts.en:
Archil lives in the village of Breti, Kareli district. He is 49 years old and lives with his wife Manana and two sons (17 and 15 years old). Archil and Manana are in charge of the family agricultural business. The children go to a local secondary school. 

Archil’s family earns on average 600 Laris per month from agricultural activities. They have three milk cows and a calf. Dairy products (mainly traditional Georgian cheese) are sold on the local market. Along with the above-mentioned, Archil’s family owns approximately 2.5 ha of agricultural land, where garlic, tomatoes and onions are grown. The harvested vegetables are sold locally. 

It’s now the season for sowing vegetables and Archil needs a loan to cultivate the land and purchase tomato seeds and fertilizers. Archil hopes that after fertilizing he will have good harvest. The earned profit will be used to cover the house renovation expenses and hence the living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to cultivate agricultural land and purchase tomato seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is 55 years old and lives in Vanadzor city. He is married and has two sons. The elder son lives and works in the Russian Federation, and his younger son lives separately from his parents.

For a long time Ashot worked as a shoemaker. As Ashot confessed, he had a terrible period in his life – He had taken part in the Nagorno Karabakh conflict, and during cruel fights in Shushi and Stepanakert he was wounded. After the war Ashot had a little health problem, but he couldn't stay at home, and so for a long time he engaged in shoe trading in the Vanadzor clothes market.

Now Ashot is a taxi driver. He works with his own car which was produced during the Soviet Union period.  Ashot needs a 500,000 Armenian drams loan to buy a new car for his activity.

loans.use: To buy a new car for his activity.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a variety store for additional income. She is a widow and she is working hard to provide income for her family.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan for her to buy raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in her business. Profits from her business will definitely help to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Milagros hopes to grow her business and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria, 52, is married to a farmer and blessed with two children. She has owned and operated a motorcycle transport for almost two years. With this business, she's earning an income of 2,000 PHP a month. She wants to access a loan amounting to 15,000 PHP to repair and maintain her motorcycle. Her income from this motorcycle transport usually goes to her family's daily expenditures. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to repair and maintain her motorcycle.

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante is 47 years old, married and has three children. Dante’s wife operates a sari-sari (general) store in their village. His wife’s income from the business provides for their daily household expenditures. Dante manages a livestock business primarily raising and fattening hogs. 

Due to the increasing stock in the market, and especially the growing agricultural supply, Dante is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feed for his hogs. The loan will help him grown his hogs faster and sell them at the right time.

loans.use: to buy feed for his hogs.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 65 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Sarah is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Sarah has been farming vegetables for 13 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Sarah successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her vegetable farming business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to purchase a vehicle for her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is 43 years old and married with two children.

Ma. Victoria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling dried seaweed in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional dried seaweed to sell.

Ma. Victoria has borrowed and paid for six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buisness buying and selling dried seaweed for 23 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Ma. Victoria aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried seaweed to sell.

loans.name: Crisologa

texts.en:
Crisologa is a 59-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Bohol, a province in the Philippines. Crisologa owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. Her husband uses it to transport passengers. They are also in engaged in rice farming. 

Crisologa wants to avail herself of a loan to buy spare parts for the motorcycle like tires, nuts and bolts and chains. With this, they will be able to maintain the good working condition of the motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the motorcycle like tires, nuts and bolts and chains.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle, 29, is married to a welder and blessed with three children. She's been selling fruits and vegetables at the public market in Cauayan City for almost fifteen years. From this business she's earning an income amounting to 10,000 PHP each month. She wanted to request a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase mangoes and vegetables to sell. She's hoping that this loan will be granted so that she can improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un groupe de l’association Sabougnouma de Ouelessebougou. Il regroupe 7 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiment à l’image de Sitan  qui est debout au milieu rang de derrière. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Ouelessebougou dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux ans. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. 
Sitan, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à Ouelessebougou, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter un stock important de condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes (poivre, tomate, oignon, concentrée de tomate, choux et le Sounbala.). Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses condiments à Ouelessebougou, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group from the Sabougnouma association of Ouelessebougou town. It groups together 7 women who got to know each other thanks to family and neighbourly relationships. They have an average age of 50, are married and have, on average, 4 children. They all have different businesses, such as the buying and selling of condiments, like Sitan, who is standing up in the back row in the picture. They all live in extended, traditional family environments in Ouelessebougou, in the prefecture of Kati (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali). They have all been small traders for several years and are highly sought after in their line of work. The members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program 2 years ago, in order to be able to satisfy the growing demands of their customers, and are on their 3rd group loan.

Sitan, who is the group's leader and very well-known in Ouelessebougou, excels in the sale of condiments. She plans to use her loan to buy a large inventory of all sorts of food condiments (peppers, tomatoes, onions, tomato concentrate, cabbage and sumbala, a condiment made from nére seeds). She gets her supplies in Bamako and from the local wholesalers, and sells her condiments to a retail clientèle in Ouelessebougou, for cash or credit to a customer base composed of men and women. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 20 000 francs, an amount which will enable her to repay her loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy food condiments.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in a rice farming business for more than 15 years now. Her husband also works as a fisherman.

Carmen is requesting a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, they will be able to improve their farm, thus augmenting their harvest and yield. In the future, Carmen hopes to expand her business so that it will generate more revenue so she can support the needs of the family and also to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Tanaiwa Group

texts.en:
Febby is 57 years old and she is a widow. She has five children aged 40, 33, 31, 22 and 20 and all of them are no longer in school. She does not have any other dependents and does not have any other source of income besides her business.

She operates a stall at Chitima green market in town and has been in this business for more than twenty years. The business is doing well. She faces the challenge of high competition. 

Febby wants to open a shop in the next 5 years. With the profits from the business she will be able to buy food and pay her grandchildren's tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for resale

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie has offered different kinds of bags, wallets and belts since 2010. Her first business location was within the public market of Santiago, but now she has transferred to the Public Market of Cordon because her business location burned down. According to her, it's really hard to start all over again but it would be more difficult to totally stop running her retail business.

Melanie would like to ask for additional capital of 10,000 PHP to allow her to re-stock her stall. She will use to purchase traveling bags, sling bags, backpacks and some wallets and belts for her retail stall. She hopes to obtain this loan amount so she can recover from her big losses and be able to provide her family basic necessities. Malanie believes that success relies on hard work and wise management of business. She's doing her best to succeed both with her family and her business.

loans.use: to purchase traveling bags, sling bags, backpacks and some wallets and belts for her retail stall.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert, 33, is a farmer in Litein County in Kenya, where he lives with his wife and two children who are all in school. He has been practicing mixed farming for the past seven years, producing tea and milk, which he sells at the market in his local area.

He is requesting a 50,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a chaff cutter that will help him in harvesting more food for his dairy cows, thus allowing them to produce more milk and earn him extra income to uplift his family's livelihood. He will use some of the profit to pay school fees for his children.

Lack of enough capital and drought are his major challenges in farming.

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфие 37 лет. Она замужем и имеет одного сына. Муж и сын работают в дехканском хозяйстве. Зулфия тоже хочет помогать семье. Она умеет вышивать национальные женские одежды. Но у нее нет швейной машины. Поэтому Зулфия решила брать кредит и приобрести швейную машину. Ее мечта скопить достаточно денег и сделать ремонт в доме.
texts.en: Zulfiya is 37 years old. She is married and has one son. Her husband and son work in the village collective farm. Zulfiya also wants to help her family. She can embroider traditional Tajik women's dresses. But she does not have a sewing machine. This is why Zulfiya decided to take out a loan and buy a sewing machine. Her dream is to save enough money to do remodeling in her home.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Zairah

texts.en:
Zairah's business involvement is with a mobile phone and cellphone accessories business. She has run this kind of business for two years. According to Zairah, her first business location was inside the public market of Santiago, but because of an unexpected fire that destroyed almost all of the businesses there, she decided to look for another business location. 

Because of this situation she encountered, she decided to borrow additional capital amounting to PHP10,000. She will be using this loan to buy some cellphone units, cellphone accessories such as casings and headsets, as well as DVD players and CD players for additional products to offer within her new business location. 

Zairah hopes that through this loan she can further recover all her big losses and enable her to improve her sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy DVD players, CD players, cellphones and cellphone accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials for constructing a zero gazing unit.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 52 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from farming rice. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials for constructing a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy materials and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Muhammadrizo

texts.ru:
Мухаммадризо житель района Кумсангир. Ему 28 лет. Он женатый молодой человек. У него двое маленьких детей. Мухаммадризо имеет среднее образование. 
Мухаммадризо на протяжении десяти лет занимается растениеводством. В этой области ему помогает его жена. Также у себя дома он занимается животноводством. Он разводит коров, мелко - рогатый скот, кур, а также зайчиков. Этим видом деятельности он занимается девать лет. Мухаммадризо берет кредит для расширения деятельности в области животноводства. Он очень надеется на Вашу помощь.
texts.en:
Muhammadrizo is a resident of the Qumsangir region. He is 28 years old. He is a married young man and has two small children. Muhammadrizo has secondary education.

During the last ten years he has been cultivating crops. His wife was helping him in this business. He also does animal husbandry at home. He breeds cows, small horned cattle, chickens as well as rabbits. He has been in this business for nine years. Muhammadrizo is taking out the loan to expand his animal husbandry business. He is very hopeful for your help.

loans.use: to expand animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Adela Francisca

texts.es: Adela Francisca tiene 34 años de edad, es soltera y madre de dos hijos de 9 y 18 años, ambos estudiantes, es costurera desde hace 16 años, su actividad consiste en corte y confección, enmendar o reparar ropa, también ha incluido dentro de este negocio la venta de ropa nueva variada de manera ambulante: camisas, faldas, shores, camisolas, pantalones, zapatos, entre otros, empezó su negocio debido a la gran necesidad que tenía su familia ya que su núcleo familiar se vio desintegrado debido a la muerte de su padre y desde muy pequeña únicamente contó con la ayuda de su mamá quien le enseño el oficio para que pudiera ayudarla a sufragar los gastos de ella y sus siete hermanos, con ayuda del crédito planea comprar materia prima para continuar confeccionando trajes y surtir la venta de ropa nueva, su mayor sueño es capitalizar su negocio y poder brindar buena educación a sus hijos para que sean todos unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Adela Francisca is 34 years old, single and has two children who are 9 and 18 years old and go to school. Adela has worked as a tailor for sixteen years; she cuts, tailors and repairs clothes. In addition, she sells different clothes in the streets, like shirts, skirts, shorts, camisoles, pants and shoes.

She started this activity due to the difficulties her family was going through and the problems that came with her father’s death. As a little girl, she only had her mother’s support, who taught her this line of work so she could support herself and help support her seven siblings.

With this loan, she plans to buy materials for tailoring dresses and stock her business with new clothes. Her biggest dream is to have more capital in order to provide her children with a good education so that they grow to be good professionals.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and buy shirts, fabric, threads, shoes, and skirts among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Givi

texts.en:
Givi has been an auto mechanic for about 5 years. He does this business in his own garage, here he has the necessary equipment for this activity. Givi has many clients from Vanadzor city and the nearby villages. Givi is pleased with his occupation. His brother also helps him in this occupation. For around one year, Givi worked as an auto mechanic in the Russian Federation, but he decided to move back to his motherland because of his parents. He returned and now shares the burden of his family and takes care of his mother, who is sick. 

Givi is 28 years old and lives with his parents and brother in Vanadzor city. His father is has a floor grinding business. 

Givi is requesting a loan of 600,000 AMD from Kiva to repair the roof of his garage and for buy new equipment for his business.

loans.use: to repair the roof of his garage and for buy new equipment for his business.

loans.name: Valijon

texts.ru:
Валичон житель района Кумсангир. Ему 31 год. Он женатый человек. У него один ребенок. Жена Валичона занимается домашним хозяйством. Сам Валичон имеет среднее образование.
Валичон занимается растениеводством. У него при доме имеется участок земли, где он выращивает овощи и сажает фруктовые деревья. Этим видом деятельности Валичон занимается пять лет. Он берет кредит для посева пшеницы.
texts.en: Valijon is a resident of the Qumsangir region. He is 31 years old and a married man. He has one child. Valijon's wife is a homemaker. Valijon has secondary education and does field crop cultivation. He has a plot of land at home where he grows vegetables and plants fruit trees. Valijon has been in this business for five years. He is taking out the loan to sow wheat.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 4 boxes of chicks, fodder, vaccines, vitamins and building materials.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has three children, of whom two are employed.

Ali is a car mechanic. He established his business in 2005, and now he has an employee. He built up good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Ali is requesting a sum of $3,000 as a loan to buy equipment specialized for his job. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy equipment specialized for his job

loans.name: Hadi

texts.en:
Hadi is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and has two children. Hadi is the only provider of the family. 

Hadi owns a small shop and specializes in washing and ironing various types of clothes. He established his business in 2010. He built a good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Hadi is requesting a sum of $2,400 as a loan to pay to expand his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay to expand his shop

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
Fadel is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and has a single child. Fadel lives with his brothers and parents. Fadel, his fathers and three of his brothers provide the income of the family.

Fadil owns a small restaurant and specializes in making barbecue. He established his business in 2011, and now he has an employee. He has built a good experience in this field and he has an excellent reputation in the surrounding area.

Fadil is requesting a sum of 2,400 USD to renovate his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Karrar

texts.en:
Karrar is from Iraq. He is a youth client, aged 27 years old, who is married and has a child. Karrar, his parents and his three brothers live in the same house. Karrar and his brothers provide the family income. 

Karrar has a small cafeteria. He specializes in serving snacks and drinks. He established his business in 2011 and now he has an employee. He has built up good experience in this field and he is becoming well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a sum of $1,500 as a youth loan to pay the yearly rent of his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the yearly rent of his shop

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en:
Mouhammad, age 34, is a grocer. He and his wife have five children, and he is the only provider for the family. 

In his small grocery store, Mouhammad sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, fruits, and vegetables, as well as snack foods and detergents. He established his business in 2004. He has built up good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area. He has an excellent reputation.

Mouhammad is requesting a loan in the amount of $2,400 in order to renovate his shop and increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is from Iraq. He is 65 years old, married and has three children. Hasan and his wife provide the family income. 

Hasan owns a small shop and specializes in selling electrical goods like refrigerators, ovens, washing machines and microwaves. He established his business in 2004. He has built a good experience in this field, and he is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Hasan is requesting a sum of $2,400 to pay the yearly rent of his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to open another shop in the future.

loans.use: to pay the yearly rent of his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Uranchimeg, 37 years old, lives with her husband and four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Her husband had the profession of teacher and now runs a clothing sales business. The clothes he sells are imported from China at a reasonable price, and even though the business has been running just for seven months, it has attracted quite a number of customers. She herself is a senior teacher of linguistics at the university. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair, so she is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase construction materials such as paint, planks and bricks, etc. As a result, the family can live in a comfortable and warm place. More importantly, during winter time, the house will enable the family to use less coal for heating, and that very process contributes to the efforts against air pollution. Also, at this time of year in Mongolia, the price of construction materials is at its lowest, so buying now will spare a considerable amount of money for the family, and this money can be invested in important expenses such as education, food and entertainment.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as planks and bricks.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim, age 46, is a tailor. He established his business in 1990 and now has three employees. He has built up good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area. He has an excellent reputation. Ibrahim and his wife have two children, and he is the sole provider for the family.
 
He is requesting a loan in the amount of $3,000, which he will use to pay the yearly rent on his shop. 

He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the yearly rent on his shop

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es: Vanessa de 22 años de edad, vive al sur de la ciudad en un barrio donde finaliza   Barranquilla e inicia el municipio de Soledad y concentra actividades económicas formales,  como centros comerciales, almacenes, etc. e  informales, que circundan alrededor de estos, los cuales ha reubicado el estado local, en una plaza comercial donde los concentra, realizando con sus propietarios  acciones educativas tendientes a su formalización y mejoramiento productivo. Allí mismo está Vanessa, quien desde muy joven, a sus 17 años,  se inclinó por el comercio, y su padre fortaleciendo su ímpetu, le dio el capital semilla para ello; así mismo recibió  impulso su dos amigas, quienes la hicieron soñar con el que hoy es su negocio, donde vende calzado en las líneas formales e informales principalmente. Sus ventas las realizan de contado y con una frecuencia diaria,  desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche y sus compras las hace en almacenes  ubicados en el centro de la ciudad y a crédito. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen y de contado, calzado alusivo a una de las fiestas mas importantes de la ciudad: El carnaval de Barranquilla, que llega con derroche de colores, disfraces, al son de las tamboras que reflejan el perfil de la gente del Caribe y es una de las temporadas mas comerciales en el departamento del Atlántico. Sus metas son lograr fortalecer su negocio, comprando de contado y en mayor volumen, esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el cual comprará sandalias, chancletas con los diseños ajustados a la temporada mas alegre de la ciudad y del Caribe Colombiano. Su mayor desafío es tener un capital de trabajo suficiente para tener inventarios suficientes que le faciliten impactar a su clientela y vender mucho más.
texts.en:
Vanessa is 22 years old and lives in the south of the city in a neighborhood where Barranquilla ends and the municipality of Soledad begins. Here formal economic activities are focused on including work in malls and stores while informal activities occur around them. The local state has relocated them to a commercial plaza where they are now concentrated. Here with their owners, educational action is being taken to formalize their work and improve their productiveness. 

Vanessa works here, who since she was very young at 17 years old, began selling goods. Her father strengthened her impetus and gave her seed capital for it. Here she received the encouragement of two friends who made her dream of what has today become her business, where she sells footwear in formal and informal styles. She makes her sales in cash and on a daily basis from 9 am to 9 pm. She makes her purchases in warehouses located in the center of the city and on credit. 

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she willl buy with cash and in large volume attractive footwear for one of the most important parties of the city. The Barranquilla Carnival comes with an extravagance of color and masks that reflect the ways of the Caribbean people. This is one of the most commercial times of the year in the department of Atlántico. Her goals are to strengthen their business by purchasing in cash and in high volume. This is just the reason why she is applying for a Kiva loan, with which she will buy sandals and flip flops with designs for the happiest time of the year in the city and Colombian Caribbean. Her greatest challenge is to have enough working capital to have sufficient inventory that will help her impress her clientele and selll much more.

loans.use: to buy sandals and flip flips with seasonal designs.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Djekafo est un groupe de l’association Sabougnouma de Ouelessebougou. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de Maïmouna  qui est la deuxième personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Ouelessebougou dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux ans. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. 
Maïmouna, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à Ouelessebougou, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité  de condiment alimentaires de différentes sortes (poivre, aubergines, tomate fraiche, oignon, huile de beurre de karité, choux, cube Maggi, et sel de cuisine).  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses condiments à Ouelessebougou, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 10.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Djekafo is a group within the Sabougnouma association in Ouelessebougou. The group is made up of four women who met one another through relatives and neighbors. They are all, on average, 40 years old. They are all married and have, on average, three children each. They are active in different businesses such as buying and selling condiments. For instance, Maïmouna (standing, second from the left in the photo) is active in this line of business. The women all live in large, traditional families in Ouelessebougou, in the prefecture of Kati (region of Koulikoro, in the Republic of Mali). They have been active in the area of small-scale trade for several years now, and their businesses are in high demand.

Striving to meet the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's credit program two years ago. They are on their third group loan.

Maïmouna, the group's president and well known in Ouelessebougou, excels in the sale of condiments. She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of various condiments (pepper, eggplant, fresh tomato, onion, shea butter oil, cabbage, Maggi cubes, and cooking salt). She stocks up in Bamako and locally from wholesalers and sells her condiments in Ouelessebougou, individually, for cash or credit, to a clientele made up of both men and women.

She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA, which will enable her to pay back the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Hamdi

texts.en:
Hamdi, age 35, is a mechanic. He established his business in 2005 and now has one employee. He has gained good experience in this field and is well-known and highly regarded in the surrounding area. 

Hamdi and his wife have two children. Both parents earn income to support the family.
 
Hamdi is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,500 in order to pay the annual rent on his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, which will allow him to provide his children with good living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent on his shop

loans.name: Lemeria Ole

texts.en:
Lemeria's farming business is doing well and he has successfully paid off his previous loan. 

He has diversified to livestock fattening business, and he has applied for another business loan of 50,000 KES from KADET LTD. With this loan, he will be able to purchase cows and goats to fatten and resell at a profit.

With the improved proceeds, he plans to fully utilize his large piece of land and educate his children

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and prepare his land for planting.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Doña Lucia es casada y tiene dos hijos un varón y una mujer que están en etapa escolar, vive en la casa propia donde cuenta con un ambiente y se encuentra el dormitorio y la cocina, la  habitación es de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Las Retamas de la Ciudad del Alto, donde se encuentran en tramite de urbanización del lugar.
Actualmente trabaja junto al esposo en minibús, los recorridos y rutas del lugar están llenos de tierra y polvo, ella trabaja todos los días de la semana. El esposo es chofer sindicalizado trabajando actualmente en el sector interciudad de la ciudad de La Paz y El Alto, ambos colaboran en el pago de los servicios, comida y vestimenta.
El crédito lo requiere para la salud de su hija que tuvo un accidente se fracturó la clavícula del brazo derecho y necesita pagar para la atención médica y los implementos que se necesitarán y medicamentos. Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Lucia is married and has two school age children, a boy and a girl.  She lives in her own house.  Her environment includes a bedroom and a kitchen.  It is an adobe house with a dirt floor.  The house is located in the Las Retamas area of the city of El Alto, which is in the process of urban development.  

She currently works with her husband on a minibus.  The paths and routes in this place are full of dirt and dust.  She works every day of the week.  He husband is a syndicated driver currently working in the intercity area of the city of La Paz and El Alto.  Both of them contribute to paying for services, food, and clothing.

The loan that she needs is for her daughter’s health.  Her daughter had an accident, and she broke her right clavicle.  She needs to pay for medical attention, the special materials they will need, and medications.  This is the first time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses and to buy materials and medication she will need for her daughter, who broke her right clavicle.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Доходы от первого кредита хорошо расширили возможности семьи Эльмиры.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Эльмира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота с целью откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Эльмира планирует вложить в увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Revenues from the first loan expanded opportunities for Elmira's family. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Elmira appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 35,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock with the aim of fattening and reselling them. 

Elmira plans to invest income from the loan to expand her homestead.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, age 63, has been selling food products for the past 21 years. Ali is a hard worker, distributing his goods from his van to almost all the grocery and convenience stores in all the nearby villages. Since he has been supplying this service for many years, he is well known in the region. He and his wife have raised one child.
   
Ali is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to supplement his merchandise offerings with special-offer products that he can provide to customers at special prices or discounts.
 
Ali hopes to widen his wholesale trade more and more in the future.

loans.use: to supplement his merchandise offerings with special-offer products

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, age 36, runs a small kiosk shop. She sells a variety of items such as rice, beans, candy, sugar, oil, salt, and detergent. Due to her determination, hard work, and responsible business management, she has managed to keep her venture going for the past six years.

Lucy lives with her husband and their four children in their own home. All four of the children are enrolled in school.

Lucy's dream is for her business to flourish so that she can increase her income, which will allow her to better cater to her family's needs. She has therefore approached us for a loan amounting to KSH 15,000, which she will use to buy basic goods such as eggs, sugar, rice, beans, detergent, coffee, and milk.

She is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy basic goods such as eggs, sugar, rice, beans, detergent, coffee, and milk

loans.name: Book Yaye Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de crédit Book Yaye rassemble des femmes du même quartier qui se sont constituées en groupe de crédit grâce à des tontines mensuelles. Elles sont aux nombres de 5 et fond du commerce et de l'élevage…Leur présidente, la dame, Coura âgée de 53 ans fait de l’aviculture.Elle a une expérience de 10 ans dans ce domaine.C'est avec les bénéfices de son activité qu'elle appuie son mari dans les charges ménagères. Elle désire améliorer son activité en augmentant le nombre de poussin et satisfaire sa clientèle en ayant toujours des poulets à proposer.
texts.en:
The loan group, Book Yaye, is comprised of women from the same neighborhood who got together together thanks to a monthly savings group. There are currently 5 women in the group who are involved in business and livestock farming. 

Their president, Coura, is 53 years old and raises chicks. She has 10 years experience in this business. With the profit she makes from her business, she helps her husband cover their household expenses. She would like to improve her business by increasing her number of chicks and satisfying her clients by always having chickens to sell.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar, age 32, owns a small garage. He specializes in repairing tires. He established his business in 2004 and now has two employees. He has built up good experience and a strong reputation in his field and he is well known in the surrounding area.

Haydar and his wife have three children. He is the sole provider for the family.
 
He is requesting a loan in the amount of $2,400 in order to buy a motor generator and equipment specialized for his work. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits. This will allow him to be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator and equipment specialized for his work

loans.name: Jargalsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Jargalsaikhan, age 58, has been employed as a driver at a private business entity for the past 24 years. He lives with his wife and four children in Dornod, an eastern province of Mongolia. His eldest daughter works as a saleswoman in a supermarket, the second-eldest daughter studies at university, and the two youngest children attend high school. His wife, age 53, is a homemaker. 
 
The house the family lives in has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair. Also, since the children are growing each day, the house has reached its capacity in terms of space. For this reason, Mr. Jargalsaikhan is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500,000 MNT, which he will use to purchase construction materials such as planks, bricks, cement, and dry boards. He will utilize these materials to repair the house and to build a barn. As a result, the family will be able to live in a more comfortable and spacious place. Most importantly, the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution.
 
At this time of year, the price of construction materials is usually at its lowest, so purchasing them now will save a considerable amount of money for the family.  
 
Mr. Jargalsaikhan is a very hard-working individual who would like to see all his children successfully employed in the future.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as planks, bricks, and cement

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is from Iraq. He is 60 years old, married, and has a single child. Amer is the only provider of the family.

Amer owns a small shop and specializes in selling household goods. He established his business in 2010. He has built up good experience in this field and he is becoming well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Amer is requesting a sum of $2,400 as a loan to install a display window, an external ceiling, and a rolling shutter for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to install a display window, an external ceiling and a rolling shutter for his shop

loans.name: Mithak

texts.en:
Mithak is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and has four children. Mithak is the only provider of the family.

Mithak owns a small shop and sells women's clothing. He established his business in 2012, and has a hired employee. He has built up good experience in this field and he is becoming well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Mithak is requesting a sum of $2,400 loan to renovate his shop and to install a display window. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his children better education.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to install a display window

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is an entrepreneur. He is engaged in assessment of movable property. He has been in this activity more than 10 years. He has great repute and experience in the sphere of property assessment.   

Samvel graduated from Armenian polytechnic institute. He has worked in the Chamber of Commerce and Industry of the Republic of Armenia as an expert. Samvel lives with his wife and underage son in Vanadzor city. His wife is a doctor and works in one of the Vanadzor's hospitals as a therapist.

 Samvel wants to receive a loan of about 500,000 Armenian Dram to buy a camera and computer accessories for expanding his activity.

loans.use: To buy a camera and computer accessories for expanding his activity

loans.name: Nesiamon

texts.en:
Nesiamon is a farmer of wheat and barley. She is a hard-working woman whose farming business has been doing well. She paid off her previous loan in good time and reports that she had a very good harvest. 

Nesiamon is now preparing her land for the upcoming planting season. She intends to continue to plant wheat and barley. She is requesting a loan in the amount of KES. 60,000 from KADET Ltd, which will facilitate the purchase of seedlings and fertilizers as well as allowing her to pay the labor costs. 
 
She plans to use her increased proceeds to expand the business and grow it into a large-scale venture.

loans.use: to  buy seedlings and fertilizers as well as to pay labor costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate his shop and to install a new display window

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is 23 years old and a vigorous, married woman. For the past five years, she has run a hand-embroidery business. Zubaida is zealous about her work and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Zubaida's husband works as a salesperson at a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family. Zubaida’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

Zubaida is requesting a 20,000 PKR loan to buy materials such as threads, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet her increasing demand and grow her business. In the future, Zubaida dreams of running a training center for girls of her village. She would like to teach embroidery skills so her students can both help her to expand her business and also earn money for themselves. Zubaida is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy materials such as threads, sequins, and pearls to meet increasing demand

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 40-year-old married woman who is the mother of two children. For the past six years, she has successfully run a general store. Nasreen's husband assists her by purchasing goods from the market as he has developed many contacts over the years. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. Nasreen has previously repaid five loans and has a good repayment history.

Nasreen is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan to buy stocks of rice and flour, along with salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy rice and flour, along with salts, biscuits, and beverages

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana, age 31, is a trader in children's clothing. She buys a variety of children's clothes from the main city market and sells these to the people of her local community.  

Shabana and her husband have two children. She started her business because it was very difficult for her to meet her family's household needs with only the small income of her husband. Therefore, she decided to help her husband in earning. Now she plays a very important role in supporting her family. 

She has been in association with Kashf for the past two years. At present, she is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs. 20,000, which will allow her to purchase a greater selection of clothes in a larger variety of colors, taking into account the taste and choice of her customers. 

Shabana expects a boost in her net income through her increased sales.

loans.use: to purchase a greater selection of children's clothes in a larger variety of colors

loans.name: David

texts.es:
Don David es casado y tiene dos hijos un varón y una mujer que están en etapa escolar, vive en la casa propia donde cuenta con un ambiente y se encuentra el dormitorio y la cocina, la  habitación es de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Cotahuma de la ciudad de La Paz. No tiene ventanas ni puertas, de manera que están tapadas con frazadas.
Actualmente trabaja en transporte sindicalizado en taxi, los recorridos y rutas del lugar están llenos de tierra y polvo, ya que la ruta son aledañas y periurbanas  trabajando todos los días de la semana. 
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de puertas y ventas, ya que en La Paz bajaron las temperaturas, y así ayudara a mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Don David es poder terminar la construcción de su casa y así  mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
David is married and has two school age children, a boy and a girl.  He lives in his own house.  His environment includes a bedroom and a kitchen.  It is a brick house with a dirt floor.  The house is located in the Cotahuma area of the city of El Alto.  It does not have windows or doors; they are covered with blankets.

He currently works as a unionized taxi driver.  The paths and routes in this place are full of dirt and dust.  The route is in surrounding, periurban areas, and he works every day of the week.  

The loan that he needs is to buy doors and windows.  This is because the temperatures in La Paz have gone down, and this way he will help improve his quality of life.  This is the first time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy wooden doors and windows in order to live more comfortably.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El comité cuenta tiene 11 integrantes en donde todas se esfuerzan por salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo que todas ellas hacen, se sienten muy emocionadas por la ayuda que reciben pues les será muy buena.
Maximina, una de las miembros es vendedora ambulante de ropas, ella tiene muy buena clientela, y gracias al trabajo que hace puede ayudar a su familia. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que desea seguir ayudando a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar prendas y de esa forma poder seguir dando a sus clientes una buena variedad con la que podrá seguir ganado los ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
This committee has 11 members.  All of them strive to move forward and help their families through the work that they do.  They are excited about the help they received, which will be very good.  

Maximina, one of the members, is a street vendor who sells clothes.  She has a good clientele and is able to help her family thanks to her work.  Maximina is a hardworking person who wants to continue helping her family through her work.  She is requesting a loan in order to buy clothes.  This will enable her to continue giving her customers a good variety.  As a result, she can continue earning income to help her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mimbi Group

texts.es:
El comité Mimbi se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también se ayudan las unas a las otras para poder salir adelante.
Lourdes, una de las miembros, se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo. Comenta que tiene muy buena variedad de prendas y gracias a eso esta saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia. La meta de Lourdes es poder tener un gran negocio y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando.
Lourdes solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando y teniendo los medios para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The Mimbi committee was formed when several neighbors got together in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. All of the members of the committee develop independent activities, but they also help each other so they can get ahead. 

Lourdes, one of the members, sells all types of clothing. She says that she has a good variety and because of this she has been able to get ahead and help her family. Lourdes' goal is to have a great business and in this way be able to keep working. 

Lourdes is asking for this loan to buy all kinds of clothing and she can keep working and have the means to help her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel habita al suroccidente de la ciudad con su cónyuge y su  hijo  en la edad de 12 años; allí en ese mismo sitio, tiene una tienda donde vende artículos de la canasta familiar, en pequeñas cantidades, de acuerdo con las posibilidades de compra de sus clientes,  que son principalmente vecinos del barrio, quienes se congregan, conversan y comparten, mientras hacen sus compras diarias, porque cada tienda es un punto de encuentro cultural en los barrios de la ciudad, donde la camaradería se desborda entre quienes allí concurren , especialmente las amas de casa en su diaria tarea. Su negocio inició desde hace 1 año, aprovechando la experiencia de su esposa en este tipo de actividad  tradición de su familia y la oportunidad que percibieron en un punto de mucho impacto comercial, pues no tenia competencia y los vecinos debían trasladarse a otro barrios cercanos.  Su tarea diaria la realiza de lunes a domingos, desde las 6:30 de la mañana hasta la 9:30 de la noche y todo esto es con el fin de generar cada vez más ingresos, para sostener a su familia con un mayor bienestar. Su meta más adelante es tener un local propio y bien surtido, pero requiere crecer y para ello necesita suficiente capital de trabajo, con el que aun no cuentan. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará: " víveres, ranchos, bebidas, refrescos, enlatados, embutidos, cárnicos, para surtir su negocio, potencializando la venta a nuevos clientes, que cada vez encuentren en su negocio, todo lo que necesitan para el consumo diario. Y esta es justamente la razón de éxito de su financiamiento con Kiva. .
texts.en:
Manuel lives to the south west of the city with his wife and their 12 year old son. In this same place he has a shop where he sells everyday family items, in small quantities in accordance with the buying possibilities of his customers, principally neighbours from his neighbourhood. His customers meet, talk and share while they do their daily shopping, as each shop is a cultural meeting point in this neighbourhoods of the city. Companionship between all is noticeable., especially among the housewives in their daily chores.

He started his business a year ago, making the most of his wife's experience in this type of business activity thanks to her family traditions and the opportunity they saw in this highly commercial area, as there was no competition and neighbours had to travel to other areas. His daily activities start at 6:30 am and carry on until 9:30 pm, Monday to Sunday. He does all this in the hopes of generating more income progressively to provide his family with better well-being.

His future goal is to have his own well stocked shop but for this he needs to grow and to have enough working capital, which he does not yet have. This is the reason he is requesting a loan, his first loan cycle with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan he will buy food items, snacks, drinks, cans, cold meats, to stock his business, potentiating his sales to new customers who continually find all they need for their day to day living in his shop. This is just the reason why his Kiva loan will be so successful.

loans.use: to buy food items, snacks, drinks, canned drinks, cold meats.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 33-year-old married woman with two children who is motivated to provide for her family. For the past eight years, she has successfully run a beauty parlor in her area. Shabana has become famous in her community for providing the best quality services such as hair styling, makeup, and facials.  Her husband works as a laborer in a factory and does not earn sufficient income to support the family. Shabana makes enough to contribute in the family income.  

Shabana is requesting a 15,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy more skin care products, hair treatments, and packs of makeup kits. She will use her loan to meet her increasing client demand. Shabana is in her second loan cycle and has an excellent repayment history. She plans to use part of her profit to provide quality education to her children for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy more skin care products, hair treatments, and packs of makeup kits

loans.name: Susan Faith's Group

texts.en:
Faith's group is comprised of three hard-working women. Faith is 16 years old and lives in the town of Bunghokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is single and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past year, Faith has been working hard to manage her salon, which does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Faith has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair extensions and hair dryers for her salon to attract more clients, and will help Faith to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Faith hopes that in the future she will be able to build a permanent house for her children. 

Faith is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more hair extensions and hair dryers for her salon to attract more clients,

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Ms. Shamshad is 29 years old, a married woman, running a business of milk sales with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Shamshad’s husband. They have 12 years of experience in the field. They have two buffaloes in milk and sell their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that they make from the milk.  Shamshad looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on daily basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family.

They have five children and they need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to make more profit, they requested a loan of Rs 45,000 to buy one more buffalo to cater for more customers. They hope to have an increase in their production capacity which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater for more customers.

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Gantulga is 26 years old. He lives with his younger brother and mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They reside in their own house in his elder brother’s yard. Since 2010, Gantulga has been providing taxi service to local people using a leased automobile. Now, he has paid the full cost of his automobile and has also accumulated a vast amount of taxi service experience. Before operating a taxi service, Gantulga worked in the construction field.  His younger brother is studying at the university and has difficulty paying his tuition fees. Also, the furniture in Gantulga's house has deteriorated and needs updating. 

Gantulga is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to pay for his brother’s tuition fees and to purchase a table, dresser, and chairs. His loan will allow him to continue to work enthusiastically without worrying about his brother’s tuition. More importantly, Gantulga's mother can live in a comfortable and attractive place.

loans.use: to cover his brother's university tuition and purchase furniture for his home

loans.name: Muazma

texts.en:
Muazma is a 44-year-old married woman with five children who is motivated to provide for her family. For the past ten years, she has been successfully running a sewing business and is very well known in her community. Muazma's husband works as a laborer in a factory and does not earn sufficient income to support the family. 

Muazma is requesting a 25,000 PKR loan to purchase a new stitching machine so her daughter can assist her to complete her orders on time. Her loan will allow her to consistently meet her increasing customer demand.  Muazma is in her fourth loan cycle and has an excellent repayment history. She plans to use part of her profit to deal with the daily expenditures of her children.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Ms. Zubaida is 53 years old and a married woman. She started her business of sack-stitching ten years ago with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Zubaida’s husband. Presently, they have attained a regular list of customers and serve well in their community. 

Zubaida gets orders from the people of her community and also from the local market. To complete the orders on time she needs to purchase more spools of thread and bundles of fabric of good quality. For this she requested a loan of Rs. 45,000 from Kashf Foundation. That will help her to expand her sales which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread with bundles of fabric of good quality.

loans.name: Gankhuyag

texts.en: Mr. Gankhuyag, 47 years old, lives with his son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on his brother’s yard. His eight-year-old son goes to school. From 1987 to 1991, he worked as a welder for a private business. Since 1992 he has been providing welding and automobile repair services on his own. Last year, he began to provide taxi services. Although one year is a short duration of time, he accumulated vast amount of experience. He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase furniture such as a table, chairs, and a chest of drawers for his house. As a result, the family can live in a comfortable place where his son can do his homework enthusiastically.

loans.use: to purchase a table, a chest of drawers, and chairs

loans.name: Thelma Rosa

texts.es:
Thelma es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí su estado civil es casada y tiene dos hijos el cual están cursando su estudios superior, su profesión es técnico en administración de empresa.
Actualmente se desempeña como promotora de crédito de una financiera desde hace más de cinco años.
Ella se caracteriza por ser una buena persona con él la visión y misión de apoyar y a su familia.

El crédito que se otorgo lo destinara para suplir los gasto universitarios de su dos hijos que están estudian en otro departamento de Nicaragua, entre los gasto de mayor costo es pago de alquiler de cuarto de habitación, transporte colegiatura entre otros.

Thelma manifiesta que se siente motivada y alegre ya que a través del financiamiento por kiva y ceprodel va poder ser posible el sueño de sus dos hijos y poder formar dos buenos profesionales el cual es un gran logro para su familia.
texts.en:
Thelma is from the city of Estelí.  She is married and has two children, and they go to high school.  She is a business administration technician.  She has been working as a credit facilitator for a financial company for over five years.  She is known for being a good person with the vision and the mission of supporting her family.

She will use the loan she was given to supplement the university expenses for her two children, who are studying in another department in Nicaragua.  Among the biggest expenses are renting a room, transportation, and tuition, among others.

Thelma says that she feels motivated and happy about the loan from Kiva and Ceprodel.  She will be able to make her children’s dream possible.  They will be able to become two good professionals, which is a great achievement for her family.

loans.use: to pay university expenses for her two children.

loans.name: Jannet

texts.es:
Jannet de 28 años es una madre talentosa para los negocios, pareja de Fernando de 33 años con quien posee un gran motivo de vida que es su hijo Luis de 10 años.
Residen en una vivienda construida a base de madera adquirida poco de después de  su unión conyugal. Motivada por el trabajo y el crecimiento económico de su familia se dedico anteriormente a las actividades agrícolas optando por ocupar la puerta de su domicilio para la venta de picanterías.
Lleva 2 años con su negocio degustando a sus vecinos con anticuchos y demás antojos que prepara todas las noches, recibiendo la visita de comensales fieles a su sabor y buen trato.
Comenta que le agrada mucho su negocio puesto que se ha convertido en una vecina muy conocida logrando entablar muchas amistades. No obstante las lluvias impiden el normal desarrollo de su negocio pues debe suspender su negocio hasta la culminación del capricho de la madre naturaleza.
A manera de implementar su negocio requiere implementar la venta de bebidas heladas y refrescos a base de frutas de la zona logrando así captar mayor clientela y por consiguiente mas ingresos.
Sus planes a futuro apuntan a la ampliación de su negocio así como adecuar su domicilio con mesas y demás mobiliarios. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, agradecida por la oportunidad espera cumplir fiel y puntualmente con el pago de su préstamo.
Requiere contar con 1,000 nuevos soles e invertirlo en la compra de una refrigeradora para complementar su negocio con bebidas heladas.
texts.en:
Jannet is 28 years old and is a mother.  She has a talent for business.  She has a partner, 33 year-old Fernando, and together their greatest motivation is their son Luis, who is ten years old.

They live in a wooden house that they acquired a little after marrying.  Motivated by work and the family’s financial growth, Jannet previously worked in agriculture before choosing to start selling spicy foods from the door of her home.  For two years now she has been selling kebabs and other foods to her neighbours every evening.  She has loyal diners that return for the flavours and for the good service.

Jannet says that she really likes her business as it has made her very well known in the neighbourhood, allowing her to form many friendships.  Nevertheless, the rains stop her business from running normally as she must stop working until Mother Nature puts an end to these difficult weather conditions.  

In order to establish her business more, Jannet needs to start selling cold beverages and drinks made with local fruits.  She will then be able to attract more customers and thus earn more money.  Her future plan is to expand her business – as much as her house will allow – by having tables and other furniture.  This is Jannet’s first loan with MFP and she is grateful for the opportunity.  She hopes to make the loan repayments on time.

She needs 1000 Nuevo Soles to invest in a refrigerator to stock up her business with cold beverages.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to stock up her business with cold drinks.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
Máximo tiene 23 años aun sin compromisos conyugales espera encontrar una persona ideal y con ella formar una familia prospera. Actualmente posee una vivienda propia hecha a base de madera.
Entusiasmado por el trabajo dedicado al transporte viene desempeñándose como chofer de un vehiculo a cuyo propietario solicita en alquiler un auto station wagon con el cual recorre diversas zonas rurales de su localidad. 
Lleva 2 años desempeñándose como tal y ha logrado hasta el momento ganar mucha experiencia en el rubro. No obstante la temporada de lluvias impiden el trabajo fluido por dichas zonas puesto que aun no son vías asfaltadas.
Como joven independiente es consiente que es necesario aprovechar la capacidad de trabajo motivo por el cual desea adquirir un vehiculo menor y ponerlo en alquiler.
Sus aspiraciones para el futuro apuntan a ser propietario de un auto para transporte de pasajeros tal como lo viene desempeñando esperando así formar una economía sólida.
