Eager to meet their customers' increasing needs, the members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program four years ago.  They are now on their sixth solidarity loan.

Kodie, the group's leader, is quite well-known in Tiélé and she excels at preparing meals.  She intends to use her loan to buy a few bags of rice and various food products and seasonings (pepper, tomatoes, onions, cabbage etc.).  She buys her supplies from wholesalers, locally and in Bamako, and she resells her goods in Tiélé, for cash or on credit, to a retail customer base consisting of men and women.

She hopes to make a monthly profit of 25,000 CFA francs, a sum which will allow her to repay her loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy food supplies for the preparation of meals.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: La señora Alba Luz tiene 30 años de laborar como docente de la clase de ingles, su esposo es conductor en una empresa de transporte así ellos se ayudan para sacar a delante a sus hijos quienes dos ya son independientes solamente uno esta  cargo de ellos quien padece de retraso mental lo cual ha sido difícil el cuido y las terapias pero gracias a dios cuenta con el apoyo de un programa que ayudan a personas con capacidades diferentes, doña Alba anhela mejorar su vivienda por lo que solicita el crédito para levantar y cambiar el techo de su casa comprando laminas de zinc, perlines y pagara la mano de obra para que su hogar se vea bonito y presentable.
texts.en: Alba Luz has been working for 30 years as an English teacher, and her husband is a driver with a transport company, and this work helps them to bring up their children as well as possible, of whom two are independent and only one is still in their care, because he suffers from mental retardation.  This condition has been difficult in terms of providing care and therapies, but God be thanked, they have had the support of a program to help people with disabilities.  Alba deeply wishes to improve her home, so she is requesting a loan to raise and change the roof of her house by buying zinc roofing, support beams, and paying for labor costs to make her house look nice and presentable.

loans.use: to buy zinc coated sheets of roofing, support beams, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Kehtan

texts.en:
Kehtan is a 22-year-old single youth client who lives with his parents in Iraq. Kehtan, along with two of his brothers, provides the income for the family. He is a carpenter and specializes in engraving various designs on wood. He established his business in 2008. Kehtan has gained good experience in this field and is well known in the surrounding area with his excellent reputation.

Kehtan is requesting a youth loan of $2,400 to buy a motor generator and specialized equipment for his work. His aim is to grow his business and increase his profits so he can provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator and specialized equipment for his carpentry work

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 30-year-old businessman. He has been running his hardware store and practicing mixed crop farming with the support of wife for the past two and half years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Michael will use the loan to purchase more stock of locks, fasteners, plumbing supplies, pipes etc. 

He will reinvest the anticipated profit and expand his business. His hopes and dreams are to improve the living standards of his family, expand his hardware shop, improve land farming and give the best education to his child.

loans.use: To purchase locks, fasteners, plumbing supplies, pipes .

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Ines de 21 años es una ama de casa muy empeñosa, coparte una vida conyugal junto a Faustino de 32 años, una pareja sólida sin hijos de por medio por ahora propietarios de una vivienda construida a base de madera.
Decidida a aportar de manera considerable al desarrollo de la economía familiar optó aperturar una tienda de abarrotes en un ambiente acogedor de su domicilio.
Lleva 2 años con su negocio y hasta el momento nota una buena presencia de clientes quienes acuden principalmente por productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros. No obstante ocasionalmente posee clientes que solicitan productos al crédito y presentar retraso en el pago de los mismo llegando a afectar sus ganancias finales.
A manera de continuar con el desarrollo de su negocio desea surtir su negocio con productos que poseen mayor demanda esperando así continuar o en todo caso incrementar la afluencia de clientes.
En cuanto al futuro con su negocio planea proceder a futuro con la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble procediendo con establecer su negocio nuevamente de manera ampliada. Desea contar con 500 nuevos soles para la compra de un saco de azúcar, tarros de leche y diversas conservas que son muy solicitados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ines, 21 years old, is a very diligent housewife. She shares her life with her husband Faustino, 32. They are a solid pair without children, for now, and they own a home made of wood.

Ines decided to significantly support the family economics and chose to open a grocery store in the welcoming environment of her home.

She has had this business for two years and up until now has seen a good customer presence. The customers come mainly for basic goods such as rice, sugar, milk, etc. However, she occasionally has some customers who request their items on credit and then delay making their payments. This is affecting Ines' final earnings.

To continue developing her business, Ines wants to stock her store with products that are in the highest demand, hoping to continue, or in any case, grow, the influx of customers.

In the future, her plan for the business is to proceed with the construction of her home using quality material, continuing to establish and expand her store. She wants to use this loan of 500 nuevos soles to purchase a sack of sugar, cans of milk, and a variety of canned foods that are often requested by her customers.

loans.use:
purchase a sack of sugar, cans of milk, and 
a variety of canned foods that are often requested by her customers

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru:
Замира жительница Яванского района. Ей 23 года. Он не замужем. Замира живет вместе с родителями. Ее мать работает в дехканском хозяйстве. 
Замира на протяжении четырех лет занимается растениеводством. Она в основном сеет хлопок и пшеницу. Замира во второй раз берет кредит в Хумо. В этот раз она берет кредит для посева хлопка и пшеницы.
texts.en: Zamira is a resident of the Yavan region.  She is 23 years old.  She is not married.  Zamira lives with her parents.  Her mother works on a farm.  Zamira has been a farmer for four years.  She mostly plants cotton and wheat.  Zamira is taking out a loan from Humo for a second time.  This time she is taking out a loan for the planting of cotton and wheat.

loans.use: to plant cotton and wheat

loans.name: Una Luz Al Desarrollo| Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Una Luz Al Desarrollo” conformada por 06 mujeres emprendedoras y responsables, que tienen como fin seguir mejorando cada día. Tal es el caso de Flora de  50 años de edad, casada con tres hijos 01 de ellos aún dependiente. Flora es una madre emprendedora que  se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves menores(pollos, patos, palomas). Inició este negocio  con la idea de mejorar sus ingresos y de esta manera apoyar con los gastos del hogar,  no sin antes haberse capacitado en un curso referente a esta actividad económica. Se siente feliz porque gracias a su arduo trabajo y con la ayuda de su pareja  ha logrado emprender un nuevo negocio de alquiler de cabinas de internet. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de comida balanceada para sus animales y la compra de algunos accesorios que le hace falta en su  internet. Su mayor deseo es ver a su hijo profesional. El grupo “Una Luz Al Desarrollo” Agradecen el crédito brindado. Flora es la primera del lado derecho viste chompa a rayas y pantalón plomo.
texts.en:
This is the Una Luz al Desarrollo group, made up of six enterprising and responsible women whose goal is to continue to improve every day.  This is the case of Flora, 50, who is married and has three children, one of whom is still dependent.

Flora's an enterprising mother who makes a living raising and selling small birds (chickens, ducks, and doves).  She started this business with the idea of improving her income so she could help with the household expenses, but not before having taken a course to train for this type of job.  She's happy because thanks to her hard work and with the help of her spouse she has managed to start a new business renting use of the Internet.

She requested the loan to buy balanced feed for her animals and some Internet accessories she needs.

Her biggest desire is to see her son become a professional.

The Una Luz al Desarrollo group is grateful for the loan granted.  Flora is the first one on the right; she's wearing a striped sweater and gray pants.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en: Matilde is a 60-year-old widow with two children. She owns and operates a fish pond business, selling crabs and fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in the business. Now she is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase additional fish and crabs to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish and crabs to sell.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru:
Шахноза жительница горда Худжанд. Она замужем. Ей 25 лет. У нее двое детей. Ее дети несовершеннолетние. Муж Шахнозы работает продавцом на рынке, в магазине аудио и видео дисков.  
Шахноза портниха. Она предоставляет услугу у себя дома. Также Шахноза шьет зимние и летние махси (валенки-национальные) для торговли. Этим видом деятельности она занимается три года. Шахноза обратился в Хумо за кредитом в размере 2000 $ США для ремонта комнаты и приобретения материалов.
texts.en:
Shahnoza is a resident of the city of Khujand.  She is married.  She is 25 years old.  She has two children.  Her children are minors.  Shahnoza's husband works as a seller at the market at a CD/DVD store.

Shahnoza is a seamstress.  She works in her home.  Shahnoza also sews winter and summer mahsi (traditional felt boots) for sale.  She has been doing this for three years.  Shahnoza turned to Humo for a loan of $2000 US to remodel her room and purchase supplies.

loans.use: to remodel room and purchase supplies

loans.name: Janneth

texts.es:
Janneth de 20 años madre de 2 preciosas niñas Nicoll de 4 años y Britney de 2 tiene por compañero a Cesar de 25 años, ambos dedicados a su familia residen en una vivienda construida a base de madera adquirido hace unos meses.
Por inconvenientes en sus parcelas opto por postergar su campaña productiva para dirigirse a la ciudad junto a Cesar para posteriormente ocuparlo como chofer de un vehiculo mototaxi.
Llevan 1 año en donde ella dedicada a sus niñas vela por el bienestar familiar mientras que Cesar recorre las diversas arterias de la ciudad brindando el popular servicio.
Le agrada saber que tiene un esposo muy trabajador esperando con el tiempo acumular capital suficiente y aperturar con el tiempo una tienda de abarrotes para así aportar considerablemente a la economía familiar.
 Al iniciarse la temporada de lluvias pretenden adquirir dicho vehiculo para así dejar un lado el alquiler e incrementar sus ingresos esperando cumplir sus objetivos a largo plazo.
Este es su primer crédito con MFP, se siente muy agradecida por la confianza brindada comprometiéndose a cumplir de manera puntual con sus cuotas.
Requiere contar con 500 nuevos soles para la primera cuota en la compra del vehiculo mototaxi que planean adquirir.
texts.en:
Janneth is 20 years old. She is the mother of 2 lovely girls, Nicoll who is 4 and Britney who is 2. Her companion is Cesar who is 25 years old. Both of them are dedicated to the family. They live in a home built of wood that they bought a few months ago.

Because of the inconveniences of their plots of land they decided to delay their productive activity for later and move together to the city and for Cesar to subsequently work as a motorcycle taxi driver. It’s been a year and she is dedicated to watching over the girls wellbeing while Cesar traverses the various roadways of the city offering the popular service. She is pleased she has a hardworking husband and she is waiting for the time to accumulate enough capital to open a grocery store and thus contribute considerably to the family income. 

When the rainy season arrives they hope to buy the above mentioned vehicle and stop renting it and increase their income waiting to fulfill their long term goals. This is her first loan through MFP. She feels grateful for the confidence given and she agrees to complete the payments in a punctual manner. She needs 500 soles for the first installment for the purchase of the motorcycle taxi they are planning to buy.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi for her husband to use in his work as a motorcycle taxi driver

loans.name: Elvira

texts.ru: Элвире 28 лет, замужем.Они с мужем воспитывают 3 детей все дети дошкольного возраста. Элвира - имеет высшее экономическое образования.  В качестве дополнительного источника финансирования своей семьи, Элвира начала бизнес в торговле продуктами питания. Начатое еще в 2011 году с суммы в 200,000 сом (KGS), Эльвира имеет магазин "Апельсин" сегодня приносит около 40,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи продуктов питания. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Элвира обратилась в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку продуктов питания что увеличит ассортимент продуктов. Доходы от кредита Элвира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, и в ближайшем будущем – отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Elvira is 28 years old, she is married.  She and her husband are raising 3 children who are not school aged.  Elvira has a university economics education.  As an additional source of income for her family, Elvira started a grocery business.  Elvira owns a store "Pineapple," which was started in 2011 with a sum of 200,000 som (KGS) and today brings in around 40,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of groceries.  In order to further increase her livestock count, Elvira turned to "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase groceries in order to increase her product assortment.  Elvira plans to invest the profits from the loan into further increasing her livestock count and in the near future plans to remodel her home.

loans.use: to expand her product assortment

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with three children. She is 55 years old and is from Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Teresita owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting corn for sale to earn a living. She's been 15 years in this business. Each month, she earns 13,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 16,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

In 2010, Teresita became a member of GDMPC. In the future, Teresita wants to make improvements to her house and to finish the studies of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 48 years old, married, and lives in Calabayan, Ozamis City, Philippines. 

Felisa plants, harvests and sells bananas and corn as a source of income. She has been in this business for six years. Each month, she earns 8,500 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

Felisa joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta, 52 years old, is married and has three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

For the past ten years, Jacinta has owned and operated a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She earns a monthly income of PHP 8,500 from the business. 

Jacinta has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase new items such as candies, Milo (malted milk), shampoo, soaps, etc. 

Jacinta has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, she wants to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to  purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 44 years old and married with three children. She lives in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental.

To make a living, Lydia makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling barbecue. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 11,200 Philippine pesos a month from these activities. 

In 2009, Lydia joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia is requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like hotdogs, pork and chicken. 

Lydia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like hotdogs, pork and chicken.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old and married. Elenita owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting corn for sale. Elenita has been in her business for six years and earns 18,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2007, Elenita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old and married with four children. 

Rosario owns and manages her garden business, harvesting vegetables for sale to earn a living. Rosario has been in business for nine years and earns 5,000 PHP each month. 

Rosario joined GDMPC in 2011. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Lyzel

texts.en:
Lyzel is 38 years old and married with seven children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice to sell to earn a living. She's been five years in this business. Each month, she earns 13,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

Lyzel requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In 2010, Lyzel became a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Lyzel wants to make improvements to her house and to finish the studies of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fetilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a hog raiser at Solana. She is married and has been in her business for over five years.  She is able to supplement her spouse’s income. 

Remedios raises hogs and sells them upon maturity. She only generates minimal income from her business; that is why she hopes to increase her profits. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy hog feed and vaccines. It will help nourish her hogs so she can sell them at a higher cost.

Someday, Remedios hopes to keep gaining good profits from her business and become a successful entreprenuer.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Athina

texts.en:
Athina, 37 years old, has been separated from her husband for almost a year. She is currently living in the village of Nappaccu Grande together with her parents and other siblings. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for three years. She has a net income of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. 

Athina wanted a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase noodles, biscuits, canned goods, coffee, milk, sugar and beverages. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, biscuits, canned goods, coffee, milk, sugar and beverages

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario lives peacefully in Solana managing her small hog-raising business. She is 52 years old and married. She has been raising hogs for future sale for about 10 years now. She still hopes for a profitable business, because she only earns minimal income – just enough for their sustenance. Rosario is now asking for a 6,000 Philippine peso loan from ASKI to invest in maintaining good nutrition for her hogs. She will buy feed, medicines and vaccines. Someday, she hopes to generate good sales for her to achieve financial security.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines and vaccines for hogs

loans.name: Sos

texts.en:
Sos, 73, works very hard to provide for her family.  In addition to farming rice, she makes and sells Khmer cakes to locals to earn additional income.  She has been working in these two businesses for years and makes approximately around USD 7.00 per day.

Sos has just repaid her previous loan.  Her second loan will allow her to purchase a piece of farmland to expand her rice-growing business.  She believes that she will gain more profit with this investment.  By continuing to work with HKL, she will be able to develop her business and improve her living standards.  She appreciates all the kind lenders who constantly provide her with loans that help her to sustain her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of farmland to expand her rice-growing business.

loans.name: Cuong

texts.en: Cuong would like to take out another loan to buy a large quantity of onions to sell.  Cuong's previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that a second loan will both increase sales and the size of his business, as well as attract new customers. He also hopes that through this loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of onions to sell.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai is 42 years old, married, and has one son.  He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

To earn a living, Hai runs a internet store.  He started his business five years ago.  He is requesting a loan in order to gradually expand his business.  He will use the funds to buy a computer and maintain the computer system.  He would like to provide his customers with good quality service. 

He hopes that his business will run smoothly and help him improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a computer and maintain the computer system

loans.name: Hung

texts.en: Hung is requesting a new loan to buy to buy more iron to increase his production of metal parts. Hung's previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers and increase his sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more iron to increase his production of metal parts.

loans.name: Quang

texts.en: Quang is requesting a new loan to buy more iron materials to increase his production of iron products. Quang's previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers and increase his sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of iron pieces to increase his production of iron products, such as screws and hinges.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem, 52 years old, lives with her life partner and two of her six children in her own house in a community of Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. 

For more than 30 years, growing rice has been a constant business activity for her family. Sem and her husband are involved in producing mortars and pestles and also run a grocery store at home to supplement their normal income. Sem sells a variety of products to satisfy her customers, such as noodles, spices, sweets, beverages, laundry detergent, shampoos, and other miscellaneous household things. Her customers are her neighbors, relatives and friends who visit her store every day. The main challenge in her business is that her some of her customers buy her products on credit, and thereby slightly decrease her profit.

Sem is seeking for another loan through HKL and Kiva to invest in her retail business. With the support from this loan she intends to cover her business‘ financial needs because she wants to buy additional inventory for her retail business. She hopes to meet her customers’ satisfaction, and therefore increase her daily profit. She is very happy to continue working with HKL loans. Her dreams are to increase her sales and make some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her retail business.

loans.name: Hung

texts.en: Hung is requesting a new loan to buy quality food for selling and repair his house. This purchase will help him to better attract and satisfy his customers and also to improve the condition of his house. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business. He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his food stall and increasing sales, and it will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy quality food to sell and to repair his house

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en: Ngan is requesting a new loan to buy better quality schoolbags to sell to people in her community. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and increase her sales. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and increase her income, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better quality schoolbags to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothing for his business

loans.name: Haja Sunna

texts.en:
Haja Sunna, age 57, is a rice vendor. She began her rice sales business because it was more profitable than her previous business. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, Haja Sunna earns about 1,100,000SLL a month. She and her husband have five grown children, ages 28, 31, 35, 38, and 41.
 
Haja Sunna requires a loan in order to buy more rice. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000,000SLL. In the future, Haja Sunna plans to own a larger shop and build a dwelling house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice to offer for sale.

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en:
Meet 31-year-old Mustapha, from Moriba town Bo. He is married with two children, 3 years and 7 years old. One of his children is currently attending school. 

In 2003, Mustapha established his provisions business. He began his business because he was a student, but he could not have money to further his education. Through his little savings from friends, he decided to start a business. He works at the business every day, from morning to night. He says that the main challenge to his business is the high cost of transportation.

Mustapha requires a loan in order to buy more cartons of mayonnaise, milk, sardines, and bag sugar. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his living conditions and educate his children. In the future, Mustapha plans to open another shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy for his provisions business more cartons of mayonnaise, milk, sardines, and bag sugar.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena lives in Gardnerville, in Montserrado County, which is a commercial city in Liberia. She is 31 years old, and single with three children aged 10 to 15 years old. For the past five years she has been selling oil, rice, and flour in the local market.  She started this business with money given to her by her boyfriend.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, and flour for her business, her plan is to expand her business, educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, and flour for her business.

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en:
Hoeun, aged 38, is a loving father of one child living with his family in Reussey Keo district, an area of Phnom Penh. He strives to work to provide a proper financial solvency to the household. From a motorcycle taxi stand, he usually seeks for people to provide his service to, and he is also contacted by his frequent customers via phone. Apart from his hardship, he is fortunate to earn approximately 5 USD per day. Hoeun is very delighted that his wife helps him in generating income by raising pigs at home.

Hoeun would like to borrow this amount to buy piglets and feed for the good nutrition of pigs. Hoeun and his wife hope to distribute their pigs into the markets for a higher price when they mature. They will use the profit they will gain from the pigs to reinvest into the pig-raising business and to make some home improvements. Moreover, Hoeun will never forget about the education of his child.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed for the good nutrition of pigs.

loans.name: Chau

texts.en: Chau would like to take a further loan to buy  many kinds of quality food and ingredients to make better food for selling. Chau's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of quality food and ingredients to make better food for selling.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en: Minh is requesting a new loan to buy plaster materials for producing molds. Minh's previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attracting new customers and increasing his sales. He also hopes that through the loan, he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy plaster materials for producing molds

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en:
Cuc is a 62-year-old married woman. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

She and her husband support their family by selling meals in the local community. Cuc would like to borrow a loan to increase the working capital for her business, which will enable her to buy better quality food to sell at higher margins. 

She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers, expand her business and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy better quality food to sell at higher margins
